characters: A SERIES OF OLD KNIFE SCARS CRISS-CROSSING HER BACK FROM
OVER THIS SCENE WE HEAR A PHONE RING AND THE FOLLOWING
BACK ON BETTY SHORT BENEATH HIM-
A PHOTO OF ELIZABETH SHORT DRESSED IN BLACK
A SMALL SHOVEL PUSHING INTO THE GROUND
BUCKY HANDCUFFING BOBBY DEWITT TO A CHAIR
IN A VACANT LOT ACROSS THE WAY
THE MUG SHOT AND RAP SHEET
AS WE PULL BACK TO REVEAL
AT THE FRONT OF THE WAREHOUSE BUILDING
FOOTAGE FROM BETTY AND LINDA'S PORN FILM
AN AUTOPSY PHOTO OF ELIZABETH SHORT
RUSS MILLARD DIVIDING A STREET ATLAS INTO FOOTBEATS
WITH HIS KNIFE AND SLIPPING IT INTO A PLASTIC BAG.
A LAPD CHAPLAIN READING SOLEMNLY FROM A BIBLE
THE NOISE OF A CAR APPROACHING
OFF ONE OF THE PHOTOS WE DISSOLVE TO
ANOTHER LAPD TRIPLE CARBON INCIDENT REPORT
IN FRONT OF LEE AND KAY'S HOUSE
ON THE PORCH OF THE HOUSE
A STUDEBAKER PATROL CAR WITH LIGHTS FLASHING
RUSS MILLARD HACKING A FOUR INCH SECTION OF THE DOOR JAMB
BUCKY AND AN ENTOURAGE OF TRAILING LOCALS
A NAKED FEMALE CORPSE, CUT IN TWO AND MADE UP TO LOOK LIK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WORLD WAR II ERA PERSONNEL CARRIER transports twenty si LAPD officers into the heart of downtown Los Angeles. The sounds of glass breaking and men screaming serves as back for their arrival. We focus in on BUCKY BLEICHERT, 26, (The counterpuncher f the newsreels) as he jumps from the carrier. Bucky's minus his gun but plus a WWI tin helmet and a thr pound truncheon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of in-uniform GI's use baseball bats and two-by- fours to beat the shit out of Zoot Suit-wearing Mexicans. Most of the cops wander to the edge of the race riot and hobnob with the pockets of MPs and Shore Patrol who've ch to "restore order" by cheering on their countrymen agains the outnumbered but equally fierce zooters. Sailors shatter streetlights and shop windows. Darkness f quickly on what Bucky rightly realizes is chaos. Suddenly Bucky's RUNNING-- away from the action... down a side street and onto a QUIET RESIDENTIAL BLOCK. He slows to a jog, trying to gather his thoughts. And the voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleichert! Bleichert!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICE OFFICER has THREE MARINES IN DRESS BLUES and ONE ZOOT SUITER cornered in a center walkway. The marines swipe clumsily at the officer with their two- fours as he bobs back and forth on the balls of his feet, dodging the blows like the ex-fighter he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already knew him by reputation, had our respective records down pat: Lee Blanchard, 43-4-2 as a heavyweight, formerly a regular attraction at the Hollywood Legion Stadium. The terrified Mexican stands frozen on one side of Blanch trying to avoid the entire mess as the policeman parries marines' blows with his own truncheon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Code three, Bleichert! Bucky runs into the courtyard and immediately wades in, fending off the marines' blows to jab at them with his st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he knew me, Bucky Bleichert, light- heavy, 36-0-0, ranked tenth by Ring magazine in 1937 fighting no-name opponents in no-man's-land division. On instinct, Bucky drops his baton and begins wailing on marines with his fists, connecting hard punches with soft midsections. VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In our first year at Central we'd never spoke--but people spoke of us. Opinions about a fantasy Bleichert-Blanchard fight, and who would win. And now Blanchard moves in, lashing vicious truncheon blo to the shoulders of the marines, sending them one by one a heap. VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd heard almost all of 'em: Blanchard by early KO; Bleichert by decision; Blanchard stopped on cuts--everything but Bleichert by knockout. The marines reduced to rubble, Lee Blanchard turns his attention to the Zooter: he slaps handcuffs on him and le him away. He motions for Bucky to follow. Lee turns back to the marines: LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the halls of Tripoli, shitbirds. One of them flips Lee off. The Zooter kicks him in the ch as Lee pulls him away from them, laughing. The three men start back toward the riots. Gunshots can b heard. Palm trees blaze up into the night. LEE (cont'd) (re the Zooter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky Bleichert, meet Senor Tomas Dos Santos, subject of an all-points fugitive warrant for manslaughter committed during the commission of a Class B Felony. Snatched a purse off a hairbag and she keeled of a heart attack. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come all the way down here to roust-- LEE (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came all the way down here same as you did. (jerks a finger to the riots)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep from gettin' killed. Happened to see those jarheads beatin' on a good collar-- (nudging Dos Santos)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Habla Ingles, Tomas? The man shakes his head "no". LEE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead meat. Manslaughter Two's a gas chamber jolt for spics. Hepcat here's about six weeks away from the Big Adios. Been better off getting a couple cracked ribs from our Privates First Class back there. Blanchard spies a home with newspapers stacked on the fro porch. LEE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll never get him booked tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomas Dos Santos cuffed by his ankles to a radiator. The three men are on their second fifth of Cutty Sark swiped the kitchen cupboard. Dos Santos sings a drunken Spanish version of "The Chattanooga Choo Choo" before slumping to his side and passing out. Bucky covers him with a blanket. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom here's my ninth hard felon of the month. Six weeks he'll be sucking gas. In three years I'll be working Central Warrants. Jewboy Deputy D.A. over there wets his pants for fighters. Promised me the next spot he can wangle. BUCKY (not impressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impressive. LEE (not impressed either)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna hear something more impressive? My first twenty fights were stumblebums handpicked by my manager. My girlfriend saw you fight a couple times over at the Olympic. Says maybe you could take me. Lee gets up and wanders into the living room. From the kitchen Bucky watches Lee stare out at the flames. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta we do about the Mex? LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take 'em in the morning. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll take him. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's half yours, partner. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's all yours. And I'm not your partner. LEE (without turning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: screaming in silence.

dialogues.speaker: AS WE PULL BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: Tomas Dos Santos dying in a large Plexiglas GAS CHAMBER. Bucky stands in the back of the room, forcing himself to watch. He can't stand it and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FRONT ROW
dialogues.text: Lee also watches, elbows on knees and chin in hands. He c stand it, either. He stays.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HALLWAY AFTERWARDS
dialogues.text: Bucky watches from afar as men in suits shake Lee's hand brush imaginary lint off of his BRAND NEW SERGEANT'S STRI Their eyes meet briefly as Bucky retreats to daylight. Another TRIPLE CARBON FORM FILLED OUT ON THE CORONA... Transfer and Promotion...Sergeant Lee Blanchard... Highland Park Vice to Central Warrants...Effective 10/14/46

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An extremely bored Bucky Bleichert gives a man a speeding ticket and sends him on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky drives as a ROOKIE COP chatters in the seat next to him. ROOKIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep, three years in the Canal Zone. Nothin' but skeeter bites and drunk fights over three-dollar skank tail...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky sits at his desk filling out a form as the rookie c prattles on in the background. ROOKIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...fights over three-dollar skank tail...

dialogues.speaker: AN OLDER OFFICER
dialogues.text: walks by the rookie and rolls his eyes. Catching Bucky's look, the cop throws him a shadow punching one-two. Bucky smiles thinly. Returns to his paperwork. Then another cop passes by and breaks into a bob-and-weave. Bucky looks puzzled and annoyed. He grabs a third cop walking by (TOM JOSLIN). BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somethin' up, Tommy? TOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, that's what. (off Bucky's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Lee Blanchard over at Central Warrants? Bucky nods. TOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His partner's toppin' his twenty and goin' for early retirement. Word is the felony D.A.'s lookin' for a bright boy to fill the spot. Christ knows why but it's down to you and Johnny Vogel for the spot. Bucky takes a surreptitious peek across the room at JOHNN VOGEL, fat, slick-hair and bad skin. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His old man Fritzie's a Central Dick. TOM (chucking Bucky on the chin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But who'd look better when they bring back the boxing team, eh Buckaroo? Bucky shakes his head, dismissing the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky drives on as the rookie talks and talks... VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warrants was local celebrity as a cop. Warrants was plainclothes without a coat and tie, romance and a mileage per diem on your civilian car. Warrants was going after the real bad guys and not rousting winos and wienie waggers in front of the Midnight Mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky hits a speed-bag, building up a sweat. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told myself I didn't care. He hits the bag faster and faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A desk officer hands Bucky a note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A secretary leads Bucky into an office with CHIEF OF DETECTIVES THAD GREEN etched on the pebble glass door. Inside the office: Lee Blanchard, ASST. D.A. ELLIS LOEW, CHIEF THAD GREEN. They all sit in matched leather chairs. SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Bleichert. She exits. An awkward silence. LEE (getting to his feet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, Bucky Bleichert. Bucky, Chief Thad Green, Deputy DA Ellis Loew. Bucky shakes their hands, nodding to each.  Chief Green gestures for him to sit. CHIEF GREEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read this aloud, Officer. It's running in Sunday's Times. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Before the war, the City of the Angels was graced with two local fighters, born and raised a scant five miles apart, pugilists with styles as different as fire and ice. Lee Blanchard was a bowlegged windmill of a leather slinger-- CHIEF GREEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip down to the fire and ice part. BUCKY (searching, finding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Mr. Fire and Mr. Ice never fought each other, but a sense of duty brought them together in spirit, and both joined the Los Angeles Police Department." Blanchard cracked the baffling Boulevard-Citizens bank robbery case in 1939 and captured thrill-killer Tomas Dos Santos; Bleichert served with distinction during the '43 Zoot Suit Wars--" A glance to Lee... CHIEF GREEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skip to the end. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Both men made great sacrifices to serve their city, and on Election Day, voters are going to be asked to do the same thing--vote on a five million dollar bond proposal to upgrade the LAPD's equipment and provide for an eight percent pay raise for all personnel. Keep in mind the examples of Mr. Fire and Mr. Ice. Vote "Yes" on Proposition B." CHIEF GREEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whattya think? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subtle. Blanchard and Green smile; Loew frowns. ELLIS LOEW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prop. B's looking like a loser right now. But if we can drum up some publicity we may he able to get it passed in the '47 Special. We need to build up morale in the department. Impress voters with the quality of our men. Wholesome white boxers are a big draw, Bleichert. You know that. Bucky looks to Lee. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire and Ice. LOEW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten rounds. The Academy Gym. Three weeks from now. Right before the election. All the gate to charity. After that, we bring back the interdivisional boxing team. Wholesome fighters. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wholesome. CHIEF GREEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you in, Bucky? LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like you'll last the ten rounds anyway. Bucky eyes Lee quickly, assessing his larger but slightly softer physique. All the remaining eyes are on him. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in. Back slaps and congratulations all around. LOEW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm betting on great things from you, Bleichert. And if I don't miss my bet we may be colleagues soon. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky exits and sees Lee leaning against an unmarked car talking with a striking woman in an auburn pageboy cut. Lee waves Bucky over. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky I'd like you to meet Kay Lake. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. FAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you fight a couple times. You won. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always won. You a fight fan? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee used to drag me. I was taking somme art classes so I'd sketch the boxers. Lee puts his arm around her. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made me quit fighting the smokers. Didn't want me doin' the "vegetable shuffle." He staggers around like a punch-drunk fighter. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try not to hurt you. A flicker of anger in her eyes. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure make Loew happy. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got money on me, I gather? LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems that way. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I win I get Warrants? LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems that way. Bucky shakes his head. Turns to Kay. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think of all this, Miss Lake? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For moral reasons I hope the LAPD gets ridiculed for perpetrating this farce. For financial reasons I hope Lee wins. And for aesthetic reasons I hope you both look good with your shirts off. Bucky and Lee break into laughter. Bucky sticks out his h Lee takes it. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luck short of winning. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, too. Bucky tips his hat to Kay and turns to go. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luck, Dwight. He stops at hearing his real name. But he knows she's wai to see his reaction so he keeps walking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Bucky hits the heavy bag in the police gym while Lee sp in the background VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 77th Street lieutenant tapped as official LAPD bookmaker had Lee as an early 3 to 1 favorite... --Bucky runs through Elysian Park with two pound weights his ankles. VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...while the real bookie line had Mr. Fire favored by knockout at 2 1/2 to 1, and decision by 5 to 3. --Bucky spars with a fighter, peppering him with jab afte jab. VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even the dicks in Ad Vice had suspended bookie shakedowns because Mickey Cohen was raking ten grand a day and kickin' back five percent to the advertising agency promoting the bond issue. --Cops exchange betting markers during roll call... VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a local celebrity again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky pulls up in front of a small ugly house in a tired neighborhood. He exits the car carrying a cardboard box f of canned goods and old girlie magazines.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PORCH OF THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: a bony old man sits in a broken chair, aiming a BB pistol some balsa wood airplanes scattered in the yard.

dialogues.speaker: ON BUCKY'S FACE
dialogues.text: disgust and sadness. This is DOLPH BLEICHERT, Bucky's father. Bucky approaches pulling a chair up next to his father. Up close it's even worse: white skin stretched tight over blue veins, yellow rimming his rheumy eyes. Flecks of dirt and vomit on a fi shirt. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa? DOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guten tag, Dwight. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak English, papa. DOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Englisch Schiesser! Amerikan Schiesser! He aims the BB gun and fires at an airplane: the gun's em Bucky enters the house. Half-eaten cans of beans on the dining room table, an entire legion of broken balsa wood airplane kits. Alley cats wander in and out of the kitche nosing their faces into open tuna fish cans...

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE PORCH
dialogues.text: Dolph leans on the porch rail. Bucky returns. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say something, Papa. Get me mad. Tell me how you can fuck this place up so bad in one month. DOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du, Dwight? Du? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak...English. Papa, please. He searches his father's eyes for a response and gets non He surveys the house again. Somewhere in the corner of hi eye we see the glint of an idea...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: Bucky on the phone. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...He's had another stroke. If you could just come by and clean the place up and keep an eye on him for week or so...a hundred dollars is fine. No more than ten days. I promise. I do. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky leans against a wall watching Lee spar. Studying hi Mentally fighting the sparring partner's fight. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was better than I thought. It made what came next easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky sits at a desk with an assistant manager and fills forms. The manager counts out approximately $4,500 in cas Bucky slides him the forms. The manager slides him the ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky slides into a booth across from PETE LUKINS. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...I'm surprised but I'm not so surprised. I hear you been lookin' good. Better'n people think. Bucky pushes an envelope across to Pete. He looks in it. PETE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess what I hear is correct. Then you'll be wantin' to place this with Mickey Cohen's indie. He's got Blanchard 2 to 1-- BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not bettin' on me, Pete. PETE (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. (another beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then as a friend I feel it's my duty to tell you this: you better make it look good. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knockout between rounds eight and ten. Pete nods his head, thinking. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dragna's got a guy really sold on you. Even money. Best you're gonna get. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Pete. Pete sticks out his hand. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luck. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short of winning? PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luck. Bucky takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky takes apart his sparring partner with a series of lightning quick counterpunches. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd almost finished the Police Academy when the background check turned up my father's German-American Bund membership. Pressured by the FBI goons to confirm my patriotism, I gave the Alien Squad Sam Murakawa, a guy I'd grown up with, in order to secure my LAPD appointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky watches from across the street as AN OFF-DUTY NURSE tries to get Papa Bleichert to eat a sandwich. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old fuck never knew any better. Never knew what he cost me. Or Sammy, who'd died at Manzanar. I was a good fit in the snitch's jacket and with a little alteration I slipped easily into the whole suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky watches Lee spar. His quick eyes spying: --scar tissue over Lee's right eye --Lee dropping his left when throwing the right hook --Lee tucking his elbows too tight and opening up his rib VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had traded Warrants for a close-out on bad old debts, the eight grand I was gonna clear enough to maintain the old man in a good clean rest home for three years; the late round tank job enough to convince myself I wasn't a complete coward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay approaches Bucky as he studies Lee. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least he looks good with his shirt off. She waves to Lee between rounds. He blows a kiss back. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your sketch pad? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was never very good. Ended up with a degree in History. Masters. Lee's fight money paid for it. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Education's an expensive habit to kick. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shouldn't have quit fighting. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked him to. Besides, catching animals gave him a sense of order. You have a girlfriend, Dwight? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saving myself for Rita Hayworth. A roar from the gym onlookers. Lee's sparring partner hit the deck, blood spraying from his mouth. BUCKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quits fighting for you. Puts you through school. Quite a guy. Quite a pair. KAY (flirting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not getting married if that's what you're wondering. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? Shacking's against the regs. Probably cost him a stripe. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go, Dwight. Good luck tomorrow night. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't answer my question-- KAY (a throwaway)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee and I don't sleep together, Dwight. She keeps walking. He just stares...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A half-eaten steak and two beers gone. It's six hours lat and Bucky's still thinking about Kay's exit line. Restles He grabs his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky flashes his badge to a late-night clerk who escorts into the newspaper's morgue. Pulls a bound stack of newsp clippings and gives them to Bucky. He begins poring throu them... A newspaper photo of a BANK shifts into live action:

dialogues.speaker: A GRAINY NEWSREEL-TYPE FLASHBACK, (SLO-MO)
dialogues.text: An armored truck idles in front of the Boulevard-Citizens Bank. Three men dressed in guard uniforms run out of the front of the bank, an alarm keening in the background. Three police cars converge on the scene and a gun battle ensues... Two of the bank robbers are shot as the third m (the one carrying the money) jumps into the truck. The tr takes off, able to escape when someone from inside the tr throws open the doors and pushes the naked and bound legitimate guards out the back and into the line of pursuit... VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With no lead on the two escaped men, the heist quickly went from page one to page five. Two weeks later... A newspaper clipping headline: "Tip from Ex-boxer cop breaks B-C Bank Job" A still photo of Lee which becomes live action as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A younger Lee and four other cops tear apart a small flat a closet they find BANK GUARD UNIFORMS, BANK BAGS, and a small stash of MARIJUANA. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of Lee's snitches fingered Bobby DeWitt, a greasy little pimp with a yard long rap, as the brains behind the bank job.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH A GIANT CROWD...
dialogues.text: VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeWitt howled frame-up the entire trial, never ID'ing the driver or coughing up the dough, even after damning character testimony from some of his employees, including one Katherine Lake, formerly of Sioux Falls, South Dakota and looking to go straight.

dialogues.speaker: ELBOW...
dialogues.text: VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeWitt got ten to life at San Quentin; Lee got Kay, or maybe the other way around. BACK TO PRESENT: Bucky walks through downtown L.A., hands stuffed in his pockets like James Dean... VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both got a few weeks in the gossip pages before Kay dove into her college education and Lee down the hero's road ending in Warrants and a shack job with a woman he loved but wouldn't touch... Bucky passes A WHORE on the corner, their eyes meet for a moment and he walks on. VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come off a winning fight. Sweat- drenched, tasting blood, still wanting to go. The handbooks who made money on you bring you a girl. A pro, a semi-pro. You do it in the dressing room, or a hallway. The eleventh round of a ten round fight. And when you go back to an ordinary life, it's just weakness, a loss. Bucky turns back to give the whore a second look but she' VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To a fighter, sex tastes like blood and resin and suture scrub. I wondered if some day that would ever be different.

dialogues.speaker: A HAMMER HITTING A BELL
dialogues.text: and the fight is on.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE PACKED ACADEMY GYM
dialogues.text: Cops and mobsters sit shoulder to shoulder, cigar smoke l L.A. haze as LEE CHARGES BUCKY, the big man trying to cut of the ring. Bucky engages, dodging Lee's thundering blows and pepperi back with counterpunches... **The general fight storyline is this: a very even and br match see-sawing back and forth, Bucky doing all he can t make it into the middle rounds. Somewhere around the four or fifth round his competitive juices take over and he be trying to win at all costs. The two men hurt each other badly, and in the eighth round it's anybody's fight. Bucky punches toe-to-toe with Lee, abandoning his strateg Lee knocks Bucky out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky lies in bed, radio playing jazz. He looks horrible- face swollen, lip split, stitches across his nose. He sip whiskey from a bottle through a straw. The phone rings and rings. He refuses to answer it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky, bruised but somewhat better, stands in the hallway a very nice rest home. He surreptitiously watches his fat as the old man tries to grab at a nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete Lukins waits outside on the porch for Bucky. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll catch on soon enough. The scene widens behind the two men and we see the sign o the facility:

dialogues.speaker: KING DAVID VILLA
dialogues.text: Jewish stars adorn the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky stands in front of his mirror clipping at his stitc with scissors. He hears a voice outside his window. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Canvasback! Bucky recognizes the voice and goes to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee Blanchard, his own bruises fading, stands in the yard LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna hide in there another week? Ain't you bored yet? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gettin' there. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna work Warrants with me? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harrell's been callin' to tell you. You been hibernating-- BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I lost. Loew's deal-- LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you read the papers? The bond issue passed yesterday. Want the job, partner? Off Lee's devilish grin: VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Fire. Mister Ice. The hero and the snitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door marked "DETECTIVE'S MUSTER ROOM". Bucky, wearing h best SPORTS COAT AND SLACKS, pushes through the door.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE MUSTER ROOM
dialogues.text: Full of the LAPD's plainclothes hotshots. All stand and g Bucky a standing ovation. Lee's there, too, playing to th crowd. On the blackboard at the front of the room: 8%!!! CAPTAIN JACK TIERNEY is at the podium. TIERNEY (as introduction)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Bleichert, the men of Central Dicks, Homicide, Ad Vice, Bunco, et cetera. I'm Captain Jack Tierney. You and Lee are the white men of the hour, so I hope you enjoyed your ovation. You won't get another one until you retire. Everyone laughs. Tierney raps the podium and speaks again TIERNEY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough horseshit. This is the felony summary for the week ending November 14, 1946. First, three liquor store stickups... Tierney begins the summary as Bucky's eyes wander around room, taking in his new surroundings... Older men, coats ties... He tunes back in... TIERNEY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here's a collar'd please Cap'n Jack to no end. Sergeants Vogel, Koenig, have you read the SID memos on the Bunker Hill burglaries? FRITZ VOGEL AND BILL KOENIG, both hulking and unpleasant- looking (Fritzie being the elder version of his son Johnn The two men shake their heads "no". Tierney disapproves. TIERNEY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set of latents at the last break-in ID's one Maynard Coleman, two sodomy priors. A surefire baby raper. Highland Park's got four child sodomy unsolveds. Maybe he's our boy, maybe not. But between that and the B&E's I'd put Maynard as a high priority lamster right now. There's a list of his known associates on the bulletin board. Let's all take a look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meeting's breaking up. A tall, elegant man (RUSS MILL and a squat disheveled man (HARRY SEARS) approach Bucky. RUSS MILLARD (introducing himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russ Millard, homicides. Wife and kids thank you for the raise, Officer. Bucky smiles a dumb smile, not knowing what to say. RUSS MILLARD (cont'd) (re the other man)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My partner, Harry Sears. HARRY (stuttering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y-y-y-yes.  Th-th-thanks Officer B-B- Bleichert. Before Bucky can answer ELLIS LOEW grabs him by the elbow leads him away. ELLIS LOEW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Bleichert. Welcome to Central Warrants-- When he gets him out of ear shot: ELLIS LOEW (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have slugged with him. You were ahead on all three cards. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The proposition passed, sir. ELLIS LOEW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes but some of your patron's lost money. Play things smarter here. Don't blow this like you blew the fight. Bucky's about to respond when Lee saves him-- LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to roll, canvasback? He grabs Bucky and they head out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee cruises them through downtown, rambling about the job description. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you really quit fighting? He pulls the car into a parking lot of a Mexican restaura LEE (matter of fact)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny Siegel bought out my contract, scared off my manager. Said he'd get me a shot at Joe Louis if I'd take two dives for him. I said no, joined the Department 'cuz Jew syndicate boys won't kill cops. Anything else? BUCKY (as they exit the car)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more. What are we doin' here? LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While you were dancing with Ellis at muster I checked Maynard Coleman's KA's on the bulletin and recognized the name of a fence. Think he tends bar here...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE RESTAURANT
dialogues.text: Lee and Bucky slide into a booth on either side of BRUNO ALBANESE, halfway through plate of huevos rancheros. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruno Albanese? BRUNO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wants to know? LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police officers, Bruno. Let's make this fast so I don't have to watch you eat. Lee slides the Maynard Coleman mug shot to Albanese. LEE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know he sells to you and we don't care. Where is he? Albanese burps. BRUNO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never seen 'em before. Lee sighs. And then grabs Bruno by the back of the neck a jams his face into the hot cheese and goo of his food. Bruno's arms flap back and forth as Lee drowns him in his food. Finally Lee shrugs and pulls Bruno's face out of his food blood from his nose mixing with the grease of the enchila BRUNO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Versailles apartments. Sixth and St. Andrews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee and Bucky pull up and look for a parking spot just as MAYNARD COLEMAN trots down the front stairs and gets into car. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right there! They ease the car back into traffic and follow Coleman's from a safe distance. Bucky picks up the two-way radio. L gestures for him to put it back: Coleman's pulling into the parking lot of THE POLAR PALAC an ICE SKATING RINK. They follow. Coleman exits his car, eyeing a group of kids carrying ic skates and heading into the Polar Palace. He follows them inside... The two men follow...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE POLAR PALACE
dialogues.text: Children skate around on the ice with a giant polar bear suit. Lee and Bucky scan the area--not an adult in sight. spots some stairs leading to the restrooms and gestures t Bucky, who hustles down them.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STAIRCASE
dialogues.text: Maynard Coleman, carrying a stuffed bunny rabbit, walks u the stairs toward Bucky. Just as the two men pass Bucky P HIS GUN and puts it to Coleman's head. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police officer. You're under arrest. Coleman throws his hands in the air; the bunny drops to t ground. Bucky cuffs Coleman and leads him up the stairs a Lee comes down from above. A small voice from below Bucky: VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of him! Let go of him! Bucky looks down to see A SMALL BOY pounding on his leg. kid's hysterical. BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go a my daddy! Daddy! The resemblance is unmistakable. Two generations of Okie white trash. Bucky continues marching Coleman the elder u the stairs as Lee snags the kid, both the father and the crying like babies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee and Bucky fill out a release form for the desk office Bucky looks up to see BILL KOENIG and FRITZ VOGEL march b with barely a nod. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got here fast. (off Bucky's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The confession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee finishes typing up a report on a manual typewriter wh Bucky talks on the phone. He hangs up as Fritz Vogel and Koenig return. LEE (cont'd) (re the two meatheads)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play nice. They've got juice with Loew. KOENIG (stupid and proud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He confessed. Kiddie porks and the burglaries. Fritzie says we're all getting commendations. Bucky's POV: both Koenig and Vogel have small bits of blood spattered on their white dress shirts. VOGEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis loves the kid angle. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talk to Ellis? VOGEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's only "Ellis" to lieutenants on up, Blanchard. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Least I don't call him "kike". VOGEL (flushing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Billy. The two men push by with barely a nod in Bucky's directio BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play nice. Hm. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shitbirds. HARRY SEARS approaches their cubicle. He looks a little drunk. (And when you get to know him you'll realize that he's drunk he doesn't stutter.) HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russ says good collar today. The men nod thanks. Bucky notes the lack of stutter and t presence of a liquor smell. HARRY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Lee--I heard something you oughta know--I was over at County Parole--Bobby DeWitt got an "A" number. He'll be released to LA around mid-January. Lee bobs his head slightly as Harry moves off. He's distu but covers quickly-- LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like pot roast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee leads Bucky up the walk. Bucky's impressed with the h LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say anything to Kay about DeWitt. It'll upset her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A doll's house of Danish Modern furniture, fresh flowers polished mahogany wainscoting. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You takin' bribes, partner? LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fight stash. Kay arrives from the kitchen, smiling broadly at Bucky. S takes his hand. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Dwight. Glad you could make it. And holds his hand about two beats than usual...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay brings in the food. Bucky walks around the room, chec things out. FAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fairy tale come true, isn't it? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm? FAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house. You and Lee partners. Fairy tale. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't say I believe in fairy tales. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you've never really had to. Lucky man. (beat) Lee! Dinner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The food is finished. So is a bottle of champagne. Kay po another one, hitting Lee in the chest with the cork. Ever laughs hysterically. They fill the glasses again. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A toast...To Proposition B! BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the Bleichert/Blanchard rematch! Bigger than Louis/Schmeling! KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To fairy tales! BUCKY (abruptly, drunk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To...us! He's referring to all three of them--something which does escape or displease anyone. They clink glasses and drink.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER LAPD TRIPLE CARBON INCIDENT REPORT
dialogues.text: JANUARY 10, 1947...Raymond "Junior" Nash...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee and Bucky enter the Loew's inner sanctum where they a joined by Russ Millard and Harry Sears. A stack of L.A. Heralds sit on the desk, the top one folded to the headli "Criminal Division's DA to try for Boss's Job in '48 Primary?" Bucky's look of disgust says it all just as Loew walks in the room-- LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goin' into politics, Ellis? Give us a quote. (as FDR) "The only thing to fear is fear itself." Loew smiles thinly and hands over a photo and a rap sheet ELLIS LOEW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the man to fear.

dialogues.speaker: THE MUG SHOT AND RAP SHEET
dialogues.text: RAYMOND "JUNIOR" NASH:  Statutory raps, armed robbery, felony mayhem...Texas State Prison...Alcatraz... The cops are impressed. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us the good news. He's in LA and actin' uppity? ELLIS LOEW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witnesses made him at a stickup near Leimert Park over the weekend. Pistol- whipped an old lady. She died about an hour ago. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything common in the sex beefs? ELLIS LOEW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negro girls. Young ones. All the complainants have been colored. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeya in Leimert Park. As they walk out... ELLIS LOEW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant Blanchard? Try not to kill the man. I'd like to do it in court. Lee flashes a demon smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A montage of shots as Lee and Bucky cruise south on Crens Boulevard. The beginning of the post-war boom. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From November through the New Year, Lee and I captured a total of eleven hard felons, eighteen traffic warrantees and three parole and probation absconders... On Crenshaw's northern end, once grand and now dilapidate houses in the process of demolition, their faces replaced giant billboards advertising department stores, jumbo shopping centers and movie theaters. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After tours of duty, Lee and I would go to the house and find Kay. Sometimes she made dinner for us, other times the three of us would go dancing, or see a flick. Southbound, older wooden structures looking more and more unkempt. Empty lots... VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always she'd be there, never in between us, but always in the middle. It was the best time of my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee pulls the car into the parking lot. Jumping out of th car-- LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This grand tour stuff's for shit. I'm callin' in some favors. He heads to a payphone and beings pumping coins into it.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE CAR
dialogues.text: Lee gets back in the car. He's pale, sweating. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a tip. Snitch a mine says he's shacking with some poon in a crib near Slauson and Hoover. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all colored down there-- LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We fuckin' roll. He pulls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee and Bucky roll up on four men loitering on a corner. Three are black and one is white. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopheads. Let's shake 'em for an address or a name. As Lee and Bucky exit the car, the four men immediately s the slow walk to the wall, arms over their heads. The whi guy glances at Lee: WHITE HOPHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the---Blanchard? LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, shitbird. Lee pushes him closer to the wall and starts frisking him Bucky starts with one of the other men, pulling out some marijuana cigarettes. Out of the corner of his eye, Bucky sees the black man closest to Lee reaches for something shiny in his belt-- BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Partner! Bucky pulls his .38... THE WHITE GUY swings around and LEE SHOOTS HIM twice in t face-- THE FIRST BLACK MAN pulls a SHIV free and BUCKY SHOOTS HI the neck-- ANOTHER OF THE MEN goes for his trousers, fumbling for something as BUCKY SHOOTS HIM THREE TIMES. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky duck! Bucky hits the cement and gets an upside down view of Lee the last man drawing guns on each other--Lee's three shot cutting down the man before he can fire his tiny derringe Bucky pulls himself to his feet, stumbling past the blood covered sidewalk and vomits in the gutter. FROM THE DISTANCE: THE SOUND OF SIRENS. Bucky pulls out his badge and pins it to his jacket pocke Behind him, Lee is busy turning the dead men's pockets in out--scattering shivs and reefers onto the sidewalk away the blood. All the while Lee cries like a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky and a Detective exit a de-briefing room. Bucky look worn but composed. DETECTIVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your time, Officer. And your police work, as well. They pass another de-briefing area where Lee sits with another Detective. Lee looks terrible, muttering and shivering. DETECTIVE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your partner's taking this hard. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew one of the guys. Baxter Fitch. Busted him once for loitering. Sort of liked the guy. The detective nods sympathetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee and Bucky walk up the front steps where they're met b Kay. She runs to Lee and embraces him. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh baby. Oh babe. She escorts him into the house. Bucky sees a newspaper on front porch railing. The evening edition of The Mirror. "Boxer Cops in Gun Battle. Four Crooks Dead." Publicity boxing photos accompany a full-page article. Bu begins to read it when he hears from inside: LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone! You'll never fucking understand-- A door slam. Soon after the sound of Lee's motorcycle roa off... After a beat Kay comes outside and sits down next Bucky. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew one of the guys. She nods. BUCKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was them or us. She nods again. BUCKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow's off-duty so treat him nice-- KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby DeWitt gets out in a week, Dwight. We're on edge. He swore at the trial he was going to kill Lee. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can take care of Bobby DeWitt. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee's scared. You don't know Bobby. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know as much as I need to know. Kay gives him a look: that's what you think. She gets up goes inside. Not knowing what to do, Bucky continues read the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky wanders inside, obviously fidgety and not wanting t home. He putters around their living room. From the back the house Bucky hears the sound of A SHOWER RUNNING. Bucky walks back to the bathroom, drawn there by the soun the drumming water. The bathroom door is open, an invitat He stops at the threshold of the bathroom. His POV: Kay stands in the shower, curtain open for Bucky's benefi She faces him and he takes in the view of her nakedness. Her attitude is not one of seduction, however, her expres passive and fixed even when their eyes meet. She pirouett for him, showing:

dialogues.speaker: THIGH TO SPINE.
dialogues.text: The history of Bobby DeWitt. Bucky backs away, retreating as he chokes back tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky's awakened by the phone ringing. He pulls the recei off the cradle but leaves it on the nightstand. From the receiver he barely hears: LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rise and shine partner! Bucky grabs the phone. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee? You okay? LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Ran Mulholland at a hundred and ten. Played house with Kay all day yesterday. Feel like doing some police work? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior Nash's got a fuck pad on Norton and Coliseum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky and Lee pull up to a mangy apartment building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They push the door open to reveal a filthy little flop littered with muscatel short dogs and used rubbers. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okie trash. They poke around for a minute, finding nothing. The smell awful. Bucky goes to a window and pulls it open.

dialogues.speaker: IN A VACANT LOT ACROSS THE WAY
dialogues.text: A cluster of uniformed cops and men in civilian clothes s at something in the weeds. A CORONER'S VAN parks next to three black and whites and two detectives' sedans. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee. Lee goes to the window. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Millard and Sears? An LAPD PHOTO VAN pulls up next. Lee and Bucky sprint out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photo men have already begun fanning out and taking photo Bucky sees Harry Sears take a shot from a hip flask in fu view of other officers. Lee and Bucky elbow their way to front and see: The nude, mutilated body of a young woman, cut in half at waist. Another wide cut down her center reveal an empty cavity--her organs have been removed. Her face has been bashed in and her mouth cut ear to ear leering smile. Even the experienced cops are rattled by the scene. They point and whisper and generally begin to fall into disbel and disorder when

dialogues.speaker: RUSS MILLARD
dialogues.text: whistles harshly with his fingers in his mouth. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before this gets out of hand let's put the kibosh on something. If this gets a lot of publicity we're going to get a lot of confessions. So we keep some things quiet. This girl was disemboweled. You keep this information to yourselves. Not your wives, not your girlfriends, no other officers. The men all nod, coming together as Millard takes control RUSS MILLARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reporters view the body. You photo men, take your pictures now. Coroner's men, you put a sheet on the body as soon as they're done. Set up a perimeter six feet back. Any reporter crosses it, arrest him. (noticing Bucky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleichert. What are you doing here? Where's Blanchard? Bucky indicates Lee, crouched down by the body taking not BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nash is renting a room in that building over there. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood on the premises? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. This isn't him. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lab'll be the judge of that. Millard and Bucky look dawn the street to see cars swingi onto Norton, beelining for the commotion. Reporters and photographers begin pouring out of their cars, quickly co up against a line of cops keeping them from the body. Bucky makes his way over to Lee, unable to stop staring a the body. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Junior Nash, remember? LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't do this. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He beat an old woman to death. That's why he's our priority warrantee. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't ours, partner-- LEE (on edge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is now, partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too sheet-covered stretchers are shoved into the coroner' wagon. The doors slam shut and the car pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: RUSS MILLARD DIVIDING A STREET ATLAS INTO FOOTBEATS
dialogues.text: as fifteen officers (including Lee and Bucky) wait for th assignment.

dialogues.speaker: QUESTIONING
dialogues.text: Cops ring doorbells throughout Leimert Park: OFFICER (to an old woman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you heard female screams... BUCKY (to an off-duty serviceman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...anyone discarding women's clothing? LEE (to a little kid)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...seen anyone in the lot on 39th... BUCKY (to a housewife)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and what about this man? (holds out a photo of Junior Nash)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To all of these questions a big fat "no".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky watches two Mexican bantamweights beat each other bloody. An EMPTY SEAT next to him. Irritated, he gets up leaves.

dialogues.speaker: ENT. 39TH AND NORTON
dialogues.text: Bucky gets out of his car and finds Lee standing inside t crime scene rope watching lab techs poke around in the we The entire area is lit up by arclights, illuminating the quicklime outlines of the body parts. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were supposed to meet me at the fights tonight, remember? LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priority. Remember. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priority for the Bureau. Not for us. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice white girl gets snuffed. Gotta show the voters they did the right thing passing the bond issue. It's a showcase. It's A-plus, Buck. We don't miss this. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had enough headlines for the week. Lee points to the body outline. His hand shakes a bit and maybe for the first time we sense he's wired on something LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With or without you, partner. Bucky shakes his head and begins walking away. LEE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With or without you. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky enters a mob scene. One cop holds up a front page headline: "Hunt Werewolf's Den in Torture Slaying" Along a bench, five derelict-looking men are manacled to bench. A cop walks by, notes Bucky's confusion: OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confessors. Just then the interrogation room door opens and Bill Koen leads a doubled-over fat man out of the door. KOENIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't do it. A couple officers clap satirically at their desks. BUCKY (to another cop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blanchard? OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In with Loew.(beat) And reporters. Off Bucky's concerned look we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky walks in to see Loew holding a press conference, Le dressed in a suit and sitting at his side. ELLIS LOEW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the heinous nature of this killing makes it imperative to catch this fiend as soon as possible. A number of specially trained officers, including Mr. Fire and his partner Mr. Ice...

dialogues.speaker: ON BUCKY'S FACE
dialogues.text: Disbelief. Disgust.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE WARRANTS CUBICLE
dialogues.text: Lee catches up with a pissed off Bucky. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got us detached? LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow and easy, Bucky. First I gave Loew a memo saying Nash blew our jurisdiction-- BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did what? LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. The APB still stands. We've got the pad staked. He's covered. Bucky's face says he's not sold on Lee's reasoning. LEE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One week. Just one week. After that, it's back to Junior. I promise. Bucky studies Lee's resolve; he relents. LEE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copacetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Antiseptic white with metallic slab tables. Two objects covered in sheets lay on the table. Bucky, Lee, Russ Millard and Harry Sears sit on benches facing the table. THE CORONER and a STENOGRAPHER NUN stan over the body. The coroner pulls the sheets off. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Bucky. CORONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On gross pathology, we have a female Caucasian between sixteen and thirty. Cadaver is presented in two halves with bisection level with the umbilicus. The nun scribbles furiously to keep up. The officers are between staring at their shoes and at the body. CORONER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Through-and through laceration from both mouth corners...no visible signs of neck bruises...massive depressed skull fractures...Inspection of upper half abdominal cavity reveals no free-flowing blood. Intestines, stomach, liver and spleen removed. The doctor stops to allow the nun time to catch up. Russ Millard clears his throat. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it...all right to smoke, doctor? CORONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not going to mind. Both Russ and Harry light up. CORONER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lower half of the cadaver reveals removal of reproductive organs...Both legs broken at the knee, and healing, light lash marks on the upper back and shoulders... The door opens and a police officer enters, handing a she of paper to Millard and speaking to him briefly. Millard reads the sheet and hands it to Harry, who then hands it Lee. LEE (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo. He hands it to Bucky. The note: "Girl ID'd as Elizabeth Ann Short, DOB 7/29/24, Medford, Mass." The coroner steps back from the table. CORONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Questions? RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your best guess? CORONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's what she wasn't. She wasn't raped, she wasn't pregnant, dried semen indicates voluntary intercourse within the last week...She took what I'd call a gentle whipping in the last ten days...In terms of the nitty-gritty...She was probably tortured with a knife for thirty- six to forty-eight hours before death. The cause of which is either the mouth wound or more likely she was beaten to death with something like a baseball bat. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about her insides? CORONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They came out after death. Then I'd say he drained the blood from the body and washed it clean, probably in a bathtub. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did the guy know anything about medicine or anatomy? CORONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Probably not a surgeon type--but that doesn't rule out veterinary training, biological training, or my Pathology for Beginners class at UCLA. Has she got a name yet? The cops look to each other, hesitant to speak her name. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth Short. CORONER (saluting heaven)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God love you, Elizabeth. (to Millard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell, when you get the son of a bitch who did this to her, give him a kick in the balls and tell him it's from Frederick D. Newbarr, M.D. Now all of you get out of here, I've got a date with a jumper suicide in ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack Tierney posts mug shots of Elizabeth Short as Russ, Harry, Lee and Bucky look over his shoulder. (In the background we can hear the by-now constant droning of Ell Loew to reporters, both in person and over the phone) CAPTAIN JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops popped her in '43. Santa Barbara. Underage drinking. Other than that she's clean. Four sisters. Parents divorced. Father's here in LA. Hear he sold some old portrait photos of her to the Herald. Russ makes a noise of disgust. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many confessions so far? CAPTAIN JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighteen. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Double that by morning. More if Loew got the press excited with his purple prose. LOEW (he's been eavesdropping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say my prose fits the crime, Lieutenant. Reveal Loew with Koenig and Fritz Vogel behind him. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too much publicity is a hindrance, Ellis. If you were a policeman you'd know that. Loew flushes and gives Millard a dark look. ELLIS LOEW (to Tierney)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain have you sent men to talk to the victim's father? CAPTAIN JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet, Ellis. ELLIS LOEW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about Vogel and Koenig? Tierney looks to Millard. The second in command shakes hi head ever so slightly. We understand that even though he' second in command to Jack he's in charge. CAPTAIN JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaah, Russ, who do you think we should send?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A garage apartment at the rear of a big Victorian house. and Bucky amble up and ring the buzzer. A skinny man (CLEO SHORT) in his fifties opens the door, eyeing them narrowly. CLEO SHORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops, huh? He leads them inside. The apartment resembles its residen soiled, worn and ugly. CLEO SHORT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got an alibi, just in case you think I did it. Tighter than a crab's ass, and that is air tight. The two cops sit down, sizing up his hostility. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Detective Bleichert, Mr. Short. This is Sergeant Blanchard. We'd like to express our condolences for the loss of your daughter. CLEO SHORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are. Neither of you'da lasted a round with Gentleman Jim Jeffries. (beat) As for Betty, c'est la vie. She called the tune, she paid the piper. (beat) You wanna hear my alibi? LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since you're so anxious to tell it. CLEO SHORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny on the spot at my job. Twenty- seven straight hours. Refrigerator repairman. Twenty-seven straight and the last seventeen overtime. Call my boss. He'll alibi me up tighter than a popcorn fart, and that's air tight. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was the last time you saw your daughter? CLEO SHORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty came west in '43 with stars in her eyes. I promised her three squares and a five-spot if she kept the house tidy. The cops look around at the squalor. CLEO SHORT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gave her the boot in July. She moved to Santa Barbara. Sent me a postcard couple weeks later. Some soldier beat her up bad. Last I heard from her. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that soldier her boyfriend? The old man lets out a hoot. CLEO SHORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were all her boyfriends! Not so ugly and wearing a uniform, can't go wrong there. Betty believed in quantity before quality. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You calling your own daughter a tramp? CLEO SHORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got five daughters. One bad apple ain't so bad. Lee's about to burst. Bucky motions for him to take a wal Lee goes through the den into the bathroom. From his view Bucky can see Lee chase a couple pills with a glass of water... BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any names, Mr. Short? CLEO SHORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, Dick, Harry. Don't matter. (he drifts for a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Said she was looking for movie work but...just paraded the Boulevard in those black get-ups of hers. Lee returns to the room. CLEO SHORT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wouldn't get herself killed doin' that? Who? Who wouldn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men walk out, disgusted. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus fuck. We just got handed the entire U.S. Armed forces as suspects. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip to see who writes it up? LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm staking Nash's pad for the night. See if we get any strange drive-bys at the murder sight. Do me a favor and drop in on Kay. She's worried about me. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a smart woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky opens the front door to find Kay reading a book on couch. She doesn't even look up. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Dwight. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know it was me? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee stomps, you tread lightly. Bucky appreciates her subtext. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee's-- KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess...Lee's up all night-- probably on Benzedrine again--working that poor girl's murder-- She says this as fact, not judgement. She knows him. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're worried about him. And he's worried about me. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But who's worried about you? Is that left for me? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need for that. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For such a cautious man you're quite a hardcase. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just...He's done a lot for me. Kay smiles, sweeps her arms around the perfect living roo if to reinforce to Bucky all Lee's done for her. The point is not lost on him. She crosses to him and kisses him softly on the cheek. KAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky sits at their kitchen table, eating a ham sandwich a glass of milk and filling out the police reports.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky walks in reading the Herald front page: A picture o Elizabeth Short in a striking black dress. Underneath:"Th Black Dahlia". He stops at a room where two detectives are sorting throu a steamer trunk full of letters and assorted personal eff RUSS MILLARD (O.S.) (re trunk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found it in storage down at the railway. Carbons of mash notes to sailors. Hundreds of 'em. Bucky shows him the newspaper. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank our friend Bevo Means at the Herald. Bevo's painting Betty and her black dress like some actress in that Alan Ladd movie, The Blue Dahlia. Should triple our confessions. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. RUSS MILLARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollywood will fuck you when no else will. What do you think? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I want to go back to Warrants. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No dice. You're a bright penny and I want you here. (hands him a piece of paper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty's last known residences and KA's. Go to University Station and pick up Bill Koenig. Fritzie's sick. Keep Bill on a tight leash, and you write the report because Billy's practically illiterate. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant-- RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me Russ and get out of here. Millard gestures for him to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky and Koenig walk up to the steps of an apartment hou BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you want to play this, Sarge? KOENIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fritzie usually does the talking and I stand back up. (re a leather sap in his belt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muscle job? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's try talk job. Bucky checks names on the doorbells against a couple name his piece of paper. He stops at "S. Saddon".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky knocks on the door. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Saddon? A young woman dressed in a metallic Egyptian costume open the door. SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You the driver from RKO? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police. The woman shuts the door. Seconds later the TOILET FLUSHE She returns and opens it again. SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this is about those jaywalking-- BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about Elizabeth Short. SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did all this on the phone this morning. Nine thousand questions about Betty's nine thousand boyfriends and I don't remember any of the names. Can I go now? The extras truck is due any minute. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you sit dawn and answer my questions or I bust you for the reefer you flushed. She lets him in and sits defiantly. BUCKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First question. Does a... (re to his paper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda Martin or a Marjorie Graham live here? SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Betty's other place. DeLongpre and Orange. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moved around quite a bit. You know why? Was somebody threatening her? SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty's problem wasn't enemies. It was too many friends. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've gathered that. Let's change the subject. SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout "the world of high finance"? BUCKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about movies? You girls are all tryin' to break in, right? SHERYL (re her extras costume)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in mister. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. What about Betty? SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe once. Maybe not. 'Round Thanksgiving she showed up bragging about gettin' her big break...Had one of those viewfinders around her neck? But who knows where she really got it. Betty had a tendency to-- BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...stretch the truth? SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie. A CAR HORN HONKS. Bucky walks to the window and looks outside: A FLATBED TRUCK FULL OF CLEOPATRAS waits. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your ride's here-- But she's already gone.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLYWOOD
dialogues.text: They cruise to the next address. KOENIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd the cooze say 'bout me? Bucky just stares at him; the guy's an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two men lounge on the stoop. Koenig gives them the eye as passes. Bucky checks his piece of paper against the doorbells aga Finds "M. Graham" but no Linda Martin. KOENIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm bored. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This'll just take a minute. KOENIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna take those two guys outside. Maybe they knew the cooze-- BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll handle 'em Sarge-- KOENIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I'm gonna do it! (beat) Now what do I roust 'em about? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. Ask 'em anything. Alibis. See if Betty ever engaged in prostitution... Koenig goes running outside. Bucky shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marjorie Graham sits on a couch with a dog-eared back iss of Photoplay in her hands. She's mild but well-traveled. MARJORIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Betty had this gift, you see. She was so sweet and eager to please...a bit dumb, maybe. But she'd do anything to be liked, become whatever you wanted her to be. She'd walk like you, or talk like you...but she wasn't...she was still her. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she ever tell you she was in a movie? Sometime around November? MARJORIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. She had this viewfinder and showed it around to all the guys. Said it was from the director. A co-starring role. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she say what it was? MARJORIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once she said it was for Fox. Another time Paramount. I think she was just fibbing. You know, for the boys. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember the names of any of the guys? MARJORIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don and Harold--sitting outside. She dated both of 'em once or twice. Other than that...I just...didn't really pay attention to who she was with. Marjorie looks down, fidgeting. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? You can tell me. MARJORIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...Right before she moved out...l saw her and Linda... BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda Martin? MARJORIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Her and Linda Martin--talking to this older woman up on the Boulevard. She had a man's suit and short hair like a man...Only that one time... BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying the woman was a lesbian? Marjorie nods yes. Bucky's about to press her for more when Bill Koenig barg in, all sweaty. KOENIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Them guys talked. Said the stiff peddled her twat when she got strapped bad. I called it in. Mr. Loew said to keep it zipped cuz it don't look as good. Bucky looks at Marjorie. Back to Koenig. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take their statements, Bill. I've got a little more here. Bill disappears back to the porch. BUCKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda Martin's room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky pushes open the room and finds it empty. He checks closet. Empty. Bucky runs his hand under the bed. Finds something and pu it out. A small red vinyl purse. He opens the purse. Insi is an ID. He shows it to Marjorie. MARJORIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's her. God...She's only fifteen. BUCKY (re card)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorna Martikova. Omaha, Nebraska. Runaway. When'd you see her last? MARJORIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This morning. I told her I'd called the police to come talk to us about Betty. Was that the wrong thing to do? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't have known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky emerges. Koenig stands on the stoop with the two me both of whom look like they might have seen the wrong end Koenig's less-than-subtle interrogation style. KOENIG (re the men)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't do it. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit Sherlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clapsticks come down in front of the camera: "Elizabeth Short...Screen Test #1." Elizabeth Short sits on a tiny chair in a cheap office. S dressed for an audition, overly made up and nervous. MAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name please? ELIZABETH SHORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth Short. Betty. Beth...Elizabeth. MAN (O.S)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Elizabeth. She nods, can't relax. ELIZABETH SHORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Can we try it again? MAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't even started yet. ELIZABETH SHORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky fills out forms. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used a Warrant cops special prerogative and issued an APB on Lorna Martikova aka Linda Martin. I wrote up my day's report, omitting Marjorie Graham's lead on the old dyke. I didn't need Ellis Loew quashing it along with the skinny on Betty as the part-time prostie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky pulls up in front of the house. Heads inside... VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be honest, I'd pretty much overdosed on Betty Short's low-rent last months on earth and decided to kiss off the rest of the day and head to Lee and Kay's for a sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: spread out on Lee and Kay's dining room table. Bucky stands just inside the door watching Lee study the photos, Kay a pace or two back, smoking nervously. Neithe them seem to notice him. Finally Kay sees him: KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Dwight. LEE (wired)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't a random job. Horseshit. Guy who did this...hated her. Bad. Wanted the whole goddamn world to know. Babe, you took pre-Med, whattya think? Mad doctor? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee, Dwight's here. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey partner. Bucky listen to Kay. Babe's got ideas. Good stuff-- KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kind of theorizing's nonsense, but I'll give you a theory if you'll eat something to calm yourself down. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theory on, teach. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Just a guess. But maybe there were two killers. Because the torture cuts are crude, while the bisection and the cut on the abdomen are neat and clean... CLOSE ON: Lee's face, somehow both intense and unfocused. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three days 'til Bobby De Witt hit LA. Three days since we killed four men. BACK ON: BUCKY, who turns on his heels and exits, catchin Kay's eye as he goes. VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
