A veritable how-to primer on how to extort from criminals Bucky digs deeper into the files and pulls out: ISSLER'S AD VICE FILE complete with mug shots. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Charlie. Get lost? Bucky scans the file, running his finger down the list of names, looking for something familiar. He stops at one: "SALLY STINSON". Beside her name a handwritten note: "Biltmore Hotel". He writes it down and moves to another list of names: "Kn Associates, no Prostitution Record". And there it is: "Betty Short".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky bops to jazz on his radio, pumped with adrenaline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky tears through a file as Russ watches. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So good ol' Fritzie's shaking down crooks, maybe sellin' 'em tip-offs before a roust. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him nailed. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, penny. They'd have to testify against him first. And that's not likely after he burns those carbons. But this Issler business--why hide the Issler- Betty connection? BUCKY (finding a file)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe Charlie pimped her out...to somebody Fritzie doesn't want us to know about...

dialogues.speaker: A FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: as Fritz beats on Charlie-- FRITZIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what you know about the Dahlia's missing days--

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE EL NIDO
dialogues.text: Bucky reads through a letter. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it. Here. Betty writes to one of her phantom servicemen boyfriends: (reading aloud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...had drinks with a great girl, Sally Stinson, who thinks she way be able to help me get a job cocktailing..." RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocktailing. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. That's what made it stick with me...What next, padre? RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sit tight. Go hack to swingwatch. Me and Harry'll poke around. BUCKY (displeased)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get him, too. But you've got to cool your temper. It's all patience with the big fish or they wriggle off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky lies awake while Kay sleeps. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kept me up that night wasn't the idea of Fritz Vogel extorting criminals, or Fritz Vogel bracing Charlie the pimp to see if Betty had told him something about one of her johns...maybe even Vogel, himself...No...

dialogues.speaker: A FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Ellis Loew, Fritz Vogel and Bucky drink cocktails and eat pretzels... VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...what kept me up was this thought: if Issler blabbed about Liz and her tricks I would have overheard. Fritz was confident he could keep me quiet. Ellis and Fritz clink glasses...Smile at Bucky. VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that was an underestimation I would bleed him for.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN KAY'S BED
dialogues.text: Her hand brushes against his cheek. He reaches for it.

dialogues.speaker: EXCHANGE.
dialogues.text: BUCKY (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've found her. Meet me at 1546 North Havenhurst in half an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bucky hangs up the phone. Trying to look casual he sid over to a desk with FRITZ VOGEL on the name plate and sna photo of Fritz and Johnny off the desk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A worn woman in her early thirties (SALLY STINSON) sits o stack of luggage, Russ and Bucky in chairs. She wears a c kimono and too much makeup for the middle of the day. She holds the photo of the Vogels. Shakes out her hair an closes her kimono a little. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do a lot a cops, you know. Comes with the territory. Charlie used to say it was my union dues. Keep my operator's license. She laughs a little, trying to loosen herself up. BUCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am. Please get to it. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway. It was a full-day job. C-Note and a half. Kept talkin' about givin' me "The Big Schnitzel"...more like a cocktail frank once we got down to it...Well, we screw the whole afternoon...Go down to the lobby for some dinner and there's Liz, sittin' by herself. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd hooked with her before? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three or four times. Conventioneers. And lemme tell you something, I'm pretty good at faking it. But Liz, she was good. A virtuoso, Academy Award kind of stuff-- BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --She do dyke? RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky-- SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Nothing like that. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any porn? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But I bet she'd be gooood... RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am. SALLY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, we all get to talking...Schnitzel takes a liking to her and Liz tells me she needs the dough. So I set up a trick within a trick...I take a breather and they go at it in the bedroom. A couple hours later Liz left. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did anything unusual happen? Sally thinks... SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it got a little kinky. He'd brought a couple toys...He may have...whipped her a bit. Russ and Bucky glance at each other, remembering lashmark the autopsy. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Vogel say anything about Liz? Was he gonna see her again? Anything? SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said...she liked the Big Schnitzel. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else, Miss Stinson? Her face clouds over. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two days...after...Liz got in all the papers... She has a hard time going on. BUCKY (helping her out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this when your pimp Charlie confesses? SALLY (composing herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Bad habit. Anyways, Fritzie V. shows up and shakes me hard about Charlie, whether he'd say anything about Liz to the caps. Beat me bad. Real bad. She lifts her head. Taps her nails on the suitcases underneath her. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One last time to be sure. (pointing to Fritzie's picture)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are sure this is the man that you tricked with? And tricked with Liz Short? A puzzled look covers her face. SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No mister you got it all wrong. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you said-- SALLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fritz just beat me. It was Sonny me and Liz did. Sonny. She taps her finger on John Vogel's face. SALLY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd recognize that lousy fuck anywhere. Off Bucky and Russ' shock we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they cruise the streets of skid row. While Russ talks Bucky fills a HYPODERMIC NEEDLE with an amber liquid... RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be a chimp's priest, Buck. A chimp's priest--watch the air bubbles--I shoulda known that Johnny I d need a pro to lose his cherry...Never had 'em for a kink and a cherry, though... Bucky points out the window. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE ON THE SIDEWALK
dialogues.text: Johnny Vogel wrestles with two drunks, kicking at them as they scamper into some trash. BUCKY (exiting the car)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny-- Johnny ambles over to Bucky. JOHNNY VOGEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha doin' in civvies, Bleichert? Bucky drills him in the solar plexus, doubling him over. grabs Vogel by the hair and slams his head into the roof the car as Johnny's lights dIm...

dialogues.speaker: THE BACKSEAT OF THE CAR
dialogues.text: as Russ Millard injects the needle into Johnny's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny Vogel handcuffed to a radiator, his head bobbing b and forth. His eyes trying to focus on Russ and Bucky. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pentothal's good for another couple hours. No way he can lie. Johnny's eyes drift to the pictures on the walls. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth Short, shitbird. Elizabeth fucking Short! Russ touches Bucky's arm, urging him to sit back. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a method to this, Bucky. (focusing on Johnny)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name, son? JOHNNY (slurring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know me, loot. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer me anyway. JOHNNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vogel, John G. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's sixteen and fifty-two? JOHNNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhmmm. Sixty-eight. Why'd you hit me Bleichert? I didn't do you no dirt. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Focus on January, Johnny. Your father-- JOHNNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friedrich Vogel. Fritzie. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Fritzie. He wanted you to lose your cherry. He bought you a woman for two days. Is that right? JOHNNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a woman. Not a real one. A hoooer. Johnny turns the syllable into a long laugh. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was at the Biltmore? JOHNNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy got a good rate on the room. He knew the house dick...This ain't right... RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be done soon, Johnny. You met Liz Short at the Biltmore, too? JOHNNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's her name introduced me...the hooer. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what did you and Liz do? JOHNNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We...played horse and rider. Gave her the Big Schnitz. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you whip her? Johnny thinks back, his head lolling to and fro... JOHNNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Softly. So so softly. Horse and Rider. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny. Did you kill Liz Short? Johnny jerks back spasmodically. JOHNNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no no no! I didn't kill her! RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy son-- JOHNNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't slice her! RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right...Do you know who did? JOHNNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No! Johnny's starting to sweat. Russ and Bucky lean in... RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When your Daddy found out you'd been with her, he tried to fix things didn't he? Johnny nods yes. RUSS MILLARD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He found out Charlie Issler had been picked up and he knew Charlie had this confessing problem, right? JOHNNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy...went to Ellis...to the Jewboy. Wanted to get Charlie released...but the Jewboy said no...Daddy had a morgue friend owed him a favor and got this DOA cooze...Daddy wanted Uncle Bill but Ellis Jewboy said take Bleichert. (looking right at Bucky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy said you'd do it cuz without Blanchard you were jelly. Said you were a sob sister, weak sister... Johnny starts laughing hysterically, shaking his chained like a zoo animal trying to get loose. Russ steps in fron a red-hot Bucky-- RUSS MILLARD (to Bucky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should go outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky sits out on the fire escape watching cars drive by. Russ leans out the window and hands Bucky the statement. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His statement. Signed. Bucky reads it and slips it into his pocket. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should sit on this for a little bit. Until I can talk to a legal officer. Bucky shakes his head no, climbs back inside the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky handcuffs Johnny's hands behind his back as the big cries... JOHNNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy... RUSS MILLARD (to Bucky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the shithouse until you retire, you know that. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe her this one. He squeezes Johnny's handcuffs tighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reporters follow Bucky and Johnny inside, piqued by the s of a plainclothes officer escorting a cuffed uniform insi BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No comment...No comment... (whispering in Johnny's ear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell your Daddy I know everything. Including his extortion deal. Tell him I'm goin' to the papers tomorrow. He approaches the desk sergeant. DESK SERGEANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this? A flashbulb goes off in their faces. Johnny sobs. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Officer Dwight Bleichert and this is Officer John Vogel. He hands over Johnny's signed statement. BUCKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Book him. Another flashbulb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky jogs up the steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dresses in his blue uniform, preparing to go back to w INTERCOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Bleichert, go to the watch commander's office immediately. Bucky brushes imaginary dust off his shirt and grabs his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky walks in, saluting like an idealistic rookie. Jastr stands, ignoring the salute. JASTROW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on two weeks vacation leave as of now. When you return to duty, report to Chief Green. He'll reassign you to another division. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? JASTROW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fritz Vogel just blew his brains out. That's why. All Bucky can think to do is salute again, rock firm. He walks outside and crosses into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crammed with blues awaiting roll call. They all stare at Bucky; he meets the eyes that seek his, making them look down. Defiant. As he passes he can hear the hisses: "Traitor". "Bolshevi He continues towards the door, almost out when suddenly h hears applause. Bucky turns to see,Russ Millard, Harry Sears and Thad Gre clapping good-bye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clapstick: "Elizabeth Short Screen Test #4" She sits on an ugly brown sofa, sides in her hands. Silen MAN #4 (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right, Miss Short? She looks up, seeing the camera as if for the first time. MAN #4 (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just...talk. ELIZABETH SHORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? MAN #4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the sides down. Just...talk to me. ELIZABETH SHORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you like to talk about? MAN #4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...Anything...Do you have a boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay and Bucky sit on a bench, looking out at the water. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could take sick days. Maybe a trip to Santa Barbara, or even a drive to San Francisco... BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay. FAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't owe him a thing, Bucky. I know you won't believe me. But you've more than repaid him already. He looks at her and she knows it's useless. KAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First thing. She takes his hand. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a fool, Dwight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bucky crosses the border into Mexico. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I closed out my glory days the only way I knew how--I chased the gone man.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Bucky hands out pennies and nickels to locals, flashing b his badge and snapshots of Lee.

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY AND AN ENTOURAGE OF TRAILING LOCALS
dialogues.text: as Bucky tries to shake them, pulling out his pockets to them he has no more coins.

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY QUESTIONING TIJUANA COPS
dialogues.text: graduating from small change to one dollar bills. Same of them seem to have stories to tell. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got headshakes, bullshit broadsides and a strange series of tales that rang true. One had "el blanco explosivo" beating the shit out of three jack rollers, then buying off the cops with double-saws peeled from a large roll. Another had Lee donating 200 scoots to a leper ministry priest and then driving to Ensenada.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: as Bucky drives South, passing a sign which says "ENSENAD

dialogues.speaker: MI."
dialogues.text: He passes a cluster of families walking on the side of th road. They carry suitcases and head North.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky approaches Ensenada. The trickle of families headed north has now becoming a roadside migration march. Every fifth of sixth marcher carries a torch or lantern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky cruises slowly into town and the most blatant shake he's ever seen: Rurales in brownshirts walk from peasant to peasant in th northbound migration line, taking money and attaching tag their shoulders with staple guns; plainclothes cops sell of beef jerky and dried fruit, putting coins into dispens attached to their belts. Two Rurales pull a man out of line and beat him senseless with the butts of their sawed-off shotguns. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I decided it would be wise to check in with the law before going out to question the Ensenada citizenry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky stands outside a converted church with the word POL painted in black over religious scenes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Velvet wall hangings depicting Jesus decorate the entranc hall. Blackshirts lounge on converted pews, a huge carved cross on the front desk betrays its altar origins. Bucky slides the Rurale at the desk his badge and a dolla The man saunters off down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bucky is escorted in. The man sitting behind the desk looks up. In flawless English: CAPTAIN VASQUEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Bleichert. Come in, please. I'm Captain Vasquez. How can I help you? Bucky exchanges his badge for a photo of Lee. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man's LAPD. He's been missing in Mexico since January. He was last seen headed here. Vasquez studies the photo. Bucky senses a twitch... CAPTAIN VASQUEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm afraid not. I'll ask my men, however. Staying the night? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least. VASQUEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you here alone? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have two partners waiting for me in Tijuana. Vasquez nods, hard to know if he believes Bucky any more Bucky believes him. BUCKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't mind I'll check back in the morning. CAPTAIN VASQUEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky squeezes a bit of brown water onto a handkerchief a wipes his brow off. He kicks his travel bag underneath th bed and heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bucky pulls two hairs from his head and spit-glues the the door jamb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garish neon, military personnel. Brownshirts packing seri weapons keeping the mostly white street crowd in order. HIS POV: An adobe streetfront with a neon sign: "CLUB BOX Bucky goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky finds a brightly lit room filled with sailors and h dressed Mexican strippers. He stands on his tip-toes tryi to see over the crowd to find somebody with the air of proprietor. Cn a far wall: boxing publicity stills. He wanders over.

dialogues.speaker: THE WALL OF STILLS
dialogues.text: A row of light-heavies: Gus Lesnevich, Billy Conn, and Bu Three stills over, next to Joe Louis, is Lee's photo. The all look so young...So good... An old voice in English breaks his reverie: OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleichert? Jesus. First Blanchard, then you. Who's next? Willie Pep? Bucky wheels and finds himself face to face with an old m BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blanchard? You've seen him? When? OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couple months ago. Heavy rains in February. Musta talked fights for ten hours straight. You know Blanchard thinks the feathers are the best division? me, it's the middies for sure. La Motta, Graziano-- BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he still in town? OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think so. I own this place. He ain't been back. You lookin' for a rematch? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking to get him out of a shitload of trouble. The old pug looks him up and down. OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. I'll tell ya the little I know. Heard he caused a ruckus over at the Club Satan, had to bribe his way out big with Captain Vasquez. Talk to Ernie the cook. Tell him I said to be kosher with you. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't been in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky walks into the biggest sewer you have ever seen. Th bar is a urinal trough where marines and sailors masturba while going down on nude women squatting on the bartop. B jobs are being dispensed underneath tables facing the bandstand. Up on the stage a man in a Satan costume is fucking a wom on a mattress. Next to him, a donkey with red velvet horn pinned to his head eats hay out of a bowl while drunken servicemen shout "Donkey! Donkey!" Bucky is accosted by a disgusting old woman. OLD WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wan' the bar, handsome? Breakfast of champions, one dollar. Round the world, two dollars. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie. I need to see Ernie. OLD WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vamanos! And grabs him by the arm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERNIE, a half-Mexican half-Chinese man, stands next to a vat of stew. Bucky flashes Lee's photo. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard this man gave you some trouble a while back. ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wants to know? Bucky flashes his badge, giving him a glimpse of his gun. ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You his friend? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my best friend. The chef tucks his hands into his aprons, fidgeting. ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friend drink fourteen shots of my best Mescal, a house record. That I like. He make toasts to dead women. That I don't mind. But he try to fuck with my donkey show, and that I don't take. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four of my guys he take, the fifth he don't. Rurales take him home to sleep it off. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? Ernie casually pulls a switchblade out of his apron and scratches the back of his neck with it. ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky walks outside and begins weaving his way back throu the crowds. Out of the corner of his eye he catches a cou Rurales who seem to have taken an interest in him. He dodges down an alley and cuts down another street, breaking into a slow jog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky walks backwards, checking the crowd. He's lost them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky stands in front of his door. He runs his finger up down the door jamb. The hairs are gone. With one swift kick he breaks down the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white man stands with his hands raised. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, Bleichert. I'm a friend-- Bucky gestures with his gun for the man to hit the wall. frisks him, pulling out a wallet and tossing on the bed. MAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton Dolphine, citizen of San Diego and a licensed private dick. I got seventy bucks in there but that money's jackshit compared to what Blanchard was holding. You go partners with me and it's easy street-- Bucky kicks the man's legs out and pushes his to the floo BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me all of it and you watch what you say about my partner, or it's a B&E roust and the Ensenada jail. Dolphine pulls himself up. DOLPHINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean Vasquez? How do you think I knew to follow you? He's got a vested interest in you not finding out about Blanchard. Bucky eyes the door. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he know I'm staying here? DOLPHINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Bucky steps back from Dolphine. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. Let's hear it. DOLPHINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About a month ago this Mexican woman shows up at my office in Dago. Chubby, ten tons a makeup, but dressed to the nines. Offers me five hundred to find Blanchard. Just like you I track him here where he's playing the rich gringo--

dialogues.speaker: A FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: DOLPHINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I even see him beat up two spics who insult this Senorita--Rurales stand by and do nothing. So I know he's paying protection dough. A lot of it. Then  I hear he paid off two plainclothes Rurale to snuff a coupla guys in TJ-- A FLASHBACK - BOBBY DE WITT AND FELIX CASCO BLOWN AWAY... DOLPHINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I leave a message in Dago for the woman tellin' her what I know... BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's her name? DOLPHINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delores Garcia. But it was obviously a phony. Casco ran with some rich bimbos and I'm betting she's one of his. Revenge on Blanchard for offin' Felix. Bucky tightens his grip on the slats of a wooden chair. T is hitting him hard. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. DOLPHINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I come back to Ensenada on my own, thinking about all that cash he was flashing. Bucky's jaw clenches. DOLPHINE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna hear this? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. DOLPHINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blanchard's dead. Bullet in the cabeza. (beat) Rumor is they never found any money. Bucky's head begins to reel... DOLPHINE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the Rurales. Maybe that woman or friends of hers. Who knows? I figured Blanchard was rogue, figured someone like you'd come lookin' for him. Maybe have a line on where the cash was. You knew Blanchard, maybe we can-- Bucky backhands Dolphine hard, knocking him off the chair DOLPHINE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look I didn't know it was personal! Don't hit me again-- Bucky has his gun out, leveled at Dolphine. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prove it to me. Prove it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolphine drives his car while Bucky trains his gun on him They come over a ridge and find themselves on a big bluff overlooking the ocean. A HUGE WOODEN BURNING CROSS marks spot. DOLPHINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The locals keep the damn thing lit up. They got a lotta missing relatives. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a shovel? DOLPHINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gardening tools-- BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky scavenges a spare piece of picket fence, wraps it i rag and lights a torch off of the cross. Dolphine kicks a filthy American flag in the sand. DOLPHINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Supposed to be near el bannero.

dialogues.speaker: A SMALL SHOVEL PUSHING INTO THE GROUND
dialogues.text: as Dolphine digs at gun point. After a few strokes the cr of the shovel hitting bone. Bucky terrified to look but has to know-- --a white jumper-- DOLPHINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailor's uniform. It's a sailor... Bucky breathes out hard. Unbearable. Dolphine digs on, pushing the corpse out of the way and digging further int sand. Bucky can't stand the suspense. He tucks his gun into his waistband and grabs the shovel. After a few more strokes thump of something solid. And suddenly it's there--sunburned pink skin, blond hair stitch scars on the eyebrows. Lee Blanchard. Lee Blanchard. Lee Blanchard. And Bucky's in Dolphine's truck while Dolphine's screamin for him to wait and Bucky slams the truck in reverse, knocking the burning cross to the ground and grinding out of the sand onto the road, heading north and leaving Dolp and Lee alone at the grave...Heading north like a refugee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky's car rolls up slowly as he kills the engine, tryin not to make any noise. The sun comes up, illuminating Bucky's filthy face as he watches the picture-perfect house, wishing time would sta still. Or better yet, wishing it would go back... Finally he gets out of the car and begins a long walk int the house.

dialogues.speaker: A LAPD CHAPLAIN READING SOLEMNLY FROM A BIBLE
dialogues.text: But as the camera PULLS BACK we see Bucky in his dress bl standing next to Kay in a wedding dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russ Millard and Harry Sears stand by as the only two gue VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee and Kay had lived in sin; not because their shack job was against department regs, but because the ghosts of their past had forced them to choose between love and passion, the veneer of a "fairy tale" only a band-aid for a fractured life.

dialogues.speaker: LEE AND KAY DANCING TOGETHER
dialogues.text: as Harry and Russ drink from a punch bowl... VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our true vows were made in private; bury the past, bury our ghosts, and as Kay said, "bury that fucking girl"... ANOTHER LAPD TRANSFER FORM: "Officer Dwight Bleichert...Reassigned to: Scientific investigation Detail"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky with plastic gloves on typing blood with an eye dro and a test tube. Meticulous and boring. News radio plays in the background... A Detective pokes his head in: DETECTIVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleichert? You got those prints for me? Bucky pulls a file out of a stack and gives it to him. Th nonchalance of a man whose job has become routine. DETECTIVE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. We gotta hot one I think. Bucky smiles politely and returns to his desk. The radio: ANNOUNCER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...results in the 1948 Republican primary are final...John Dougdale trouncing D.A. Ellis Loew 64% to 36%...In county primaries... This gets a smile from Bucky as he returns to his test tu and beakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detectives comb through a murder scene as Bucky collects latent fingerprints off doorknobs. No one pays him any attention. He's been relegated to the worst kind of purgatory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky and Kay drink coffee and read the morning paper. Sh absently strokes his free hand. Bucky intently reads the front page. The headline reads: "CITY COUNCIL INVESTIGATES '20s BOOM BARONS FOR SHODDY HOME CONSTRUCTION". Underneath, a picture of Sprague and Mack Sennett posing front of the HOLLYWOODLAND sign. He's startled by Kay tapping her finger on the photo. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That reminds me of something, Dwight. Bucky tries to hide his panic. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floorboard's loose near the closet. Think you could fix it? BUCKY (relieved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, babe. The phone rings. Bucky answers it. BUCKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...Hey Vic... Bucky writes something on a piece of paper. Hangs up. BUCKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta go. Work-up on a probable gunshot suicide. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds lovely. Where is it? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hancock Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky rings the bell. He's dressed plainclothes and carri technician's canvas bag. An attractive woman in her early fifties opens the door. WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Officer Bleichert. LAPD. My I express my condolences, Mrs.-- WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane Chambers. Condolences accepted. You're the lab man? He nods yes. She lets him in and he follows. JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the study in back of the dining room. You'll see the police rope. If you'll excuse me, I'll be in my garden. He notices for the first time she's dressed for gardening

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky steps over the police rope and into the study. A la desk chair lies overturned an the ground next to A TAPE OUTLINE OF A BODY. Three feet away lies A SHOTGUN. Behind the chair the brown spattering of blood and brains decorates the white wall and crown mouldings.

dialogues.speaker: A SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: as Bucky measures the splatter marks on the walls, scrape tissue from the muzzle of the gun, dusts it for latent prints, etc. At the end he wraps the gun in a plastic bag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bucky steps over the police rope and walks back toward the main foyer. He stops short.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE OPPOSING WALL
dialogues.text: hangs a disturbing PAINTING: the portrait of a clown, a y boy done up in court jester's garb. His body is gnarled a hunched. He wears a stuporous ear-to-ear smile that looks like one continuous deep scar. It is eerily reminiscent of Elizabeth Short's death wound Spooked, Bucky pulls his eyes away and settles them on ne family photos--two young women linked arm in arm. JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other survivors. Pretty aren't they? She arrives next to him, dusty with soil. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like their mother. How old are they? JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-one and twenty-three. Are you finished in the study? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Tell whoever cleans it up to use pure ammonia... (looking at the two girls)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Chambers-- JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, do you know Madeleine and Martha Sprague? The next block over? JANE CHAMBERS (snorts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those girls and that family. How do you know them? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did a little work for them once. JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consider it lucky if it was a brief encounter. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you mean? The hallway phone rings. Jane moves to answer it. JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to condolences. Thank you for being so nice, Mr.-- BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky. Good-bye, Jane. JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky writes up a report. VIC pokes his head in. VIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You finish working up the suicide, Bucky? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Pretty routine. Whattya know about the husband? VIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge Chambers? Widow said he was depressed, failing health. The terrible burden of all that money'll get you every time. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonder how he made it? VIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No mystery there. Real estate. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garage door is open to the evening air. Bucky's heavy and speed bag hang on hooks. Bucky leans against a stool, large box open on the work bench.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BOX
dialogues.text: Bucky brushes aside a clutter of junk and pulls out A PHO ALBUM. He opens it and begins flipping through: articles photos concerning Elizabeth Short. MOSTLY PHOTOS. It's like a man in a mid-life crisis fantasizing about hi high school sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER ELIZABETH SHORT CASTING SESSION
dialogues.text: "Elizabeth Short...Screen Test #5" She rambles on, almost oblivious of the camera. ELIZABETH SHORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I had a fiance, Captain Matt Durand. He was in a tank battalion. A Commander. He had...the fiercest blue eyes. Like the deep water you see from a fishing boat... She's lost in thought...we're not sure whether this is a scene, her real life, or just a sad lie...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Bucky drops the album back in the box as Kay's car pulls the driveway. He covers it back up. KAY (getting out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm...looking for the hammer. She points over his shoulder to the hammer hanging in pla view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky kneels on the ground near the closet, toolbox next him. He pulls on the floorboard, it flexes and squeaks. He uses the hammer to pull the board completely off. He squeezes wood glue around the edges and is about to repla the board when something under the floor catches his eye. He reaches into the hole, pulling out STACKS OF HUNDRED DOLLAR BILLS BOUND WITH RUBBER BANDS. He spies another scrap of paper in the hole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay pours two scotches. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight? She carries the scotches into the bedroom and finds Dwigh sitting on the floor, staring at thousands of dollars in cash. He holds a paper money band inscribed: "$100...Boulevard- Citizens Bank..." KAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I...always wondered where he kept it.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOULEVARD-CITIZENS BANK HEIST
dialogues.text: A SHOTGUN BLAST shatters the back window of the armored truck. In the front seat, LEE BLANCHARD ducks down as the driver hits the gas...

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE SCENE
dialogues.text: as Bucky leans back against the bed. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you ever going to tell me? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd given all his money to Ben Siegel. (beat) He wanted to give me a home.

dialogues.speaker: A FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Lee and Bucky, their first day as partners... LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...said I'd get a shot at Joe Louis if I'd take two dives for him. I said no...

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE SCENE
dialogues.text: as Bucky looks straight up into the ceiling light... BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you ever going to tell me? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew what Bobby was doing to me...How he'd used a razor on me...pimped me to his friends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Lee plants the incriminating bank bags in DeWitt's clo

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE SCENE
dialogues.text: Bucky staring back into the hole in the floor... KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Bobby know nothing about the bank job. He and Lee, they never even met. After Lee and his driver got away, Lee figured framing Bobby'd give me a way out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee leads Kay out of the courtroom.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE SCENE
dialogues.text: as Kay leans down next to Bucky, gently putting her hand his shoulder... KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then last year...the fourth man--the driver--he heard Bobby was getting paroled. He threatened to tell DeWitt that Lee framed him. He wanted money we didn't have. Ten thousand dollars. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever. Were you ever...? KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me this: Forgive him for DeWitt. Forgive him for the bank. It doesn't matter anymore. Not to us. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was the driver, Kay? Tell me. Tell me! He's in her face now. Okay, pal, you asked for it. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baxter Fitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three black man and a white man get rousted by Lee and Bu BAXTER FITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blanchard? Chaos erupts as Lee executes Baxter Fitch and Bucky kills others...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE SCENE
dialogues.text: on Bucky's anguished face: KAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He used you, Dwight. He did. Forgive him everything else. But don't forgive him for that. Ever. She reaches for his face and he pulls away. SLO-MO CLOSE-UP... as the crumpled money drops down into the hole in the flo into the blackness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky, stripped to bare chest, attacks the heavy beg. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire and Ice. The hero and the snitch. Bank robber and his best friend the bumfuck detective. Triggerman. Stooge. Weak point in a fairy tale triangle. He lashes into the heavy bag with a series of brutal left hooks. Kay stands in the door, watching him. Her eyes red from crying. VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would forgive Lee the bank job. And I thought I'd forgive Kay her role in keeping it from me. But the basic rule of Homicide applied: Nothing stays buried forever. Corpses. Ghosts. Nothing stays buried forever. Nothing. Kay turns around and shuts the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky and Jane drink iced tea. A glorious garden behind t JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. What brings you around again? Considering a courtin' the old rich widow? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not that old. And you're not very widowed. JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You either are or you aren't. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem to be doing all right. JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge had cancer. I half expected it. We weren't that close anymore...You married? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little over a year. JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God. Newlyweds. Nothing better, is there? Bucky's face betrays his difficulties. JANE CHAMBERS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how well do you know the Spragues? JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge and Emmett went way back. They served on the California real estate board together. But Emmett was a bit of a crook. My husband got him kicked off the board for building dangerous buildings under phony corporations. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your husband sounds like a good man. JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had his moments. Most of it was out of guilt. He owned slum blocks in San Pedro. When he learned he had cancer, he really started feeling guilty. He voted Democratic last year. Even went in and had meetings with the City Council. I'm sure he gave them dirt on Emmett. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read an article in the paper. JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same day Eldridge killed himself. Apropos, I guess. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe your husband-- JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My husband was rich and did a mean Charleston. I loved him until I found out he was cheating on me. Now I'm starting to love him again. How strange. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not so strange. They watch each other, enjoying each other's company. A strange emotional peace. JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're very accepting of other people's frailties. You're young. You should have illusions. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a cop. Illusions aren't standard issue. JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how'd a cop get mixed up with Madeleine Sprague? It was Madeleine, I assume? Bucky's gut clenches. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stopped her at a red light. One thing led to another. Why do you assume it was Madeleine? JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't play dumb, Bucky. The girl's a roundheels. Always has been. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane. Don't be catty. JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. She can't help it I'm sure. She probably inherited it from her mother. Before Bucky can press Jane stands up with the tray of ic tea. The visit is over. JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You figure out the rest, officer. He follows her back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they stop momentarily in front of the scary clown pain BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God that is spooky. JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valuable, too. Eldridge bought it for my birthday a couple years ago. I hate it. Want to take it with you? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks. JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, then. You were my best condoler. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you mine. Jane gives Bucky a warm handshake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky pulls out of June Street, and passes Muirfield. He slows for a moment, squinting down the street, trying to discern the Sprague mansion. He drives on. We hang on the sign for Muirfield Avenue as the day turns night... And down Muirfield Road, we see Bucky's car parked in the shadows. Watching the Sprague house. A voyeur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky sleeps soundly as Kay readies herself for work. She watches him for a moment, considering whether to wake him She decides not to and leaves. The minute she goes, Bucky opens his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky spies on the Spragues. He digs back into his seat a Madeleine comes down the walk and puts mail in the mail b Just for a second it looks like she sees him...maybe not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky dozes, his tie almost catching on fire in a Bunsen burner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky leans against the window, propping himself up.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE STREET
dialogues.text: Madeleine's Packard pulls out and roars up the street. Bu guns his car to follow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky follows the Packard into a crowded GI bar parking l He parks a distance away. But as he watches Madeleine get of her car he is staggered: It's ELIZABETH SHORT. Or, more accurately, it's Madeleine dressed up exactly li the Dahlia in one of her famous portrait photos. Slinky b dress, upswept hair, down to the yellow barrette. She str into the bar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky ducks into a smoke-filled GI bar where a commotion already taking place. Madeleine is surrounded by soldiers fawning all over her. Other men simply point and whisper--her Dahlia act isn't on anybody. Bucky slides into a booth in the corner to watch. He sign for a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four bourbons later. Bucky watches as Madeleine settles i a more intimate conversation with one soldier. Bucky down his drink as Madeleine grabs the GI's elbow and escorts h out of the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky sits in his car in the parking lot watching the sol loiter outside of A motel room. Madeleine returns from th office with the key and lets the two of them in. He watches as the light goes on; and then off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky comes into the bedroom to find Kay waiting up for h KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight-- He moves to her, pulling off his clothes as quickly as he can. KAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight-- He's on top of her, his bourbon stained kisses go and dow her neck and her breasts. She responds, but not quickly enough for him. He rushes i her before she's ready. Still, she tries to be there for hoping to catch up with his lust. She doesn't. And they both know it. They embrace, trying cover up the hollow awkwardness with familiar affection. It doesn't work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky sits at Thad Green's desk, penitent. THAD GREEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SID's not a bad beat, Bucky. At the time it was better than you deserved. Bucky nods. THAD GREEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blues hate you, Bucky. Vogel was their pal. I do this for you, you better be fucking supercop. Bucky just sits silent. ANOTHER LAPD TRANSFER ORDER: "Transfer order...Officer Bleichert...From SID...to Newton Street Division, Nightwatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky back in uniform again. This time, the black slums. Heroin hookers, hard-core dealers, gangs. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newton Street Division. Footbeat hacks carried metal-studded saps; squadroom dicks packed .45 automatics loaded with unregulation dum-dums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky and a large black man come tumbling out of the liqu store throwing vicious punches at each other. Bucky takes three to land six, eventually knocking the gu out. He looks across the street to see to cops watching h measuring him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bucky chases two men towards a chain link fence at the of the alley. One of them gets to the fence and scrambles it. Bucky yanks the other one off the fence, slamming him the ground. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay. Lee. Madeleine. Betty Short. For one month I escaped them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kay sleeps alone in the bed. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fucking supercop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky sits in his uniform listening to a jazz quartet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky sleeps on the couch as Kay leaves for work. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I escaped them all. Almost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky in his patrol car. The night a hot sweat. He listen music on his radio and watches two hookers dance on the corner, waving at cars. A SCRAGGLY OLD WINO staggers up to the women, stumbling around them, dancing with them. They sneer at him, tell h to beat it.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE PATROL CAR
dialogues.text: Bucky flashes his headlights at the bum. The bum ignores Bucky flashes them again, annoyed. The bum looks into the glare and flips Bucky off. And suddenly Bucky snaps, jumping from his car. In three strides he's on the bum, clobbering him with roundhouse l and rights. The women are screaming. The drunk is screaming. OLD DRUNK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleease! Bucky drops him, staggering into a phone booth. He drops nickel in the phone. Dials a number. Ring. Ring. Ring... He hangs up. Dials another. A woman's voice answers. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky's just onto the porch steps when Madeleine answers door. She's dressed like the Dahlia. He pushes her inside. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a reunion of avowed tramps, old rutters who knew they'd never have it as good with anyone else... Afterwards we'd talk through the night. The Spragues...Crazy Papa Bleichert...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixth graders write in silence. Kay sits at her desk, sad in her eyes as she watches the children. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mostly, though we'd talk about Betty. Her utter malleability, a chameleon eager to please anybody...and the disrupter of every life close to me...It would last a month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky stands in the living room, examining family photos. photo of two young, proud WWI vets: George Tilden and Emm Sprague...A photo of the dark-haired Ramona and the ruddy fair-haired Emmett...Photos of Madeleine and Martha, the brunette and the ruddy blond...Back to the first photo: George Tilden's dark hair. Madeleine wanders in, Bucky smiles at her. MADELEINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. She runs her hands over his shoulders. BUCKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought the family came back from Laguna this week. MADELEINE (her Scottish brogue)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You miss 'em, laddie? Mother's insults? Martha's pornography... BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father's Georgie Tilden war stories? He scans her for a reaction. If she has one it ripples through her almost undetectable. Almost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bucky cruises by, grinning. He salutes the house. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the scheme of things it wasn't much. Rich old lady gossip, as Jane put it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he drives onto his own modest street. VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But combine it with banging Madeleine in all twenty-two rooms of their mansion, it was good enough for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moving van in the driveway and Kay's Plymouth stuffed w boxes. Bucky double-parks and bolts up the steps. The van pulls away behind him. BUCKY (to the van driver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Goddammit! Get back here! The van driver ignores him; Bucky turns as Kay walks out the porch. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't touch your things. You can have the furniture. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babe-- KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you think I'd let my husband disappear for three weeks and do nothing about it? I've had detectives following you, Dwight. Detectives. She looks like that fucking dead girl, so you can have her--not me. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babe. Goddammit. He reaches for her and she backs out of grabbing range. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoremonger. Coward. Necrophile. She spins out of his grasp and makes for her car. She gun the engine and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky stands in the middle of the living room, cataloguin the little things. No periodicals on the coffee table, ha the record collection gone, no candlesticks. He picks up the largest chair (Lee's favorite) and throws at the wall. Next, Kay's rocking chair shatters the glass cabinets. The coffee table goes through the front window.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Bucky yanks out all the drawers, turns over the bed.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: he takes a pipe wrench to the sink, crushes the mirror wi one blow... In a terrible ten rounder with the ghosts of his past Buc demolishes the dream house, pulls his uniforms out of the closet and bolts out of the house, leaving the door open scavengers can pick the place clean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky sits on the bed, his back pushed up against the wal Eyeball to eyeball with Elizabeth Short, Betty, Liz, the Black Dahlia. A collage of photos and file folders... VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It came on then, big and ugly: bye-bye Bleichert at the bus stop, adios shitbird, has-been, never-was, stool pigeon harness bull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky stands in the worst of slums, his blue uniform a be to anyone who would do him harm. VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You traded a good woman for skunk pussy, you've turned everything that's been handed you to pure, undiluted shit, your "I will's" amount to the eighth round at the Academy gym when you stepped into a Blanchard right hand--pratfalling into clover that you turned into horse dung.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER ELIZABETH SHORT CASTING SESSION
dialogues.text: No clapsticks this time. Just Betty Short sitting an the couch. She reaches down and pulls off her pumps. Now she reaches under her dress and begins unrolling her stocking Not sexy. Empty and resigned. VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye-bye Betty, Beth, Betsy, Liz, we were a couple of tramps, too bad we didn't meet before 39th and Norton, it just might have worked. Maybe us would've been the one thing we wouldn't have fucked up past redemption...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An apartment complex has been erected at the murder site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: THE HOLLYWOODLAND SIGN. As we watch the sign changes, the "D" dropping off the end. It now reads "HOLLYWOODLAN".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky, unshaven and out of uniform, leans against his car a working class residential street. He stares across at a modest Victorian house and the garage behind it. We recog it hopefully; we've been here before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Cleo Short's apartment. Or at least it used to be. B peers in a window and sees it's filled with junk. He walks back towards the street, intent on heading back his car. on a hunch, he walks up onto the porch of the Victorian house and rings the bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Footsteps at the door. It opens to reveal another identic twin to Elizabeth Short. Bucky is stunned and can't find his tongue. GIRL (Boston accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you? (no response). Great. Take a hike you big sicko-- BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait-- She begins to shut the door but someone behind her pulls back open. Cleo Short, Elizabeth's father. CLEO SHORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, dear. I know this pug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men arrange themselves in chairs while the Betty a-alike makes herself busy in the kitchen behind Cleo. Bucky tries not to stare. He forces himself to focus on C who, while five years older, looks much better than last Bucky saw him. CLEO SHORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Came into a little change a while back, managed to trade in that shit shack out back for these digs. (beat) And I don't give a fuck what you think, you and your partner ain't much to look at now. I read the papers. Bucky can't deny that. The young woman brings in two beers for Bucky and Cleo. B checks her out again. Cleo knows why. CLEO SHORT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My youngest, Christine. He squeezes her hand affectionately. CLEO SHORT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best housekeeper of the bunch. Can't cook a damn, though. Got her sister's star-eyes for the pictures, damn straight. Thinks she's gonna be another goddamn Jayne Mansfield. Get out of here, Chrissie... She rolls her eyes, picks up a newspaper and heads out on porch. CLEO SHORT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Used to be dozens'd stop by, you know. Drive up from Dago or San Berdoo just to snap a shot of the goddamn garage back there. Thought maybe they'd find one of Betty's dresses in the garbage. Jackals. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't move far. CLEO SHORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't a mattered if I did. (beat) Whatcha here for, mug? I know you ain't smart enough to solve the case, and you ain't dumb enough to still think I did it...I had an alibi. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tighter'n a popcorn fart. CLEO SHORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's air tight, mug. Air tight. Bucky takes a swig of his beer. Cleo's eyes scour Bucky. CLEO SHORT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hooked on her still, ain't ya? Ha. That's a plug nickel you can't spend, ain't it, mug? Ha. Yea. Betty'll do that to a fella. Especially someone like you. (off Bucky's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, I know you mug. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought...Maybe after all this time...There's something you might have forgot...Anything she might have said... Cleo studies him, knows Bucky's a lost soul. He softens f the first time. Leans forward, elbows on knees. Almost looking like a father who'd lost a daughter. CLEO SHORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was a terrible actress. I'm sure folks've told you that. She'd practice in front of the john mirror. Once or twice she got me in on it...Reading parts with her for some audition. She stunk. Even a parent could tell. What Beth was good at was writing. All her teachers used to say that. Not that a grease like me'd know the difference. Maybe she coulda written for the pictures. But she wanted to be an actress like every other silly girl. His gaze drifts outside to his youngest daughter. CLEO SHORT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your folks still alive? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father. CLEO SHORT (poking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He proud of his son, the ace copper? Or maybe he thought you'd end up champ? Bucky shrugs off any talk of his father. Cleo gets it. CLEO SHORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your momma? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She killed herself a long time ago. Cleo takes a swig of his beer. CLEO SHORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably better off then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleo follows Bucky out onto the porch. Christine reads a of Photoplay. The cover touts the current Mack Sennett Revival in honor of the revised Hollywoodland sign... BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your time, Mr. Short. if-- CLEO SHORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a life, Bleichert. Don't dream it all away. Dreamin'll kill ya. (to Christine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, too. Get me a sandwich. He snatches away the Photoplay and slaps it into Bucky's hands. CLEO SHORT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean up some dog shit with this for me, willya? The man winks. Bucky takes the magazine and salutes him w it. He heads back down the walk. Behind him Cleo Short watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky sits at a light, staring north. Scaffolding drapes Hollywoodland sign. Movie lights have been set up, captur the event on film. His attention turns to Christine's Photoplay on the seat to him; the weekly rag is open to an ad for the Mack Senn revival: A reproduction of the Hollywoodland sign across the top o the page, and below it the words "Keystone Kops at the Admiral Theater--Air conditioned!" Below that a still from a Keystone Kops movie, registerin huge and loud and wrong: Three Keystone Kops standing bet pillars shaped like snakes swallowing their own tails; a inset with Egyptian hieroglyphics was behind them. Unmistakably the background that appeared in the Linda Martin/Betty Short porn film. Cars honking behind him. Bucky's transfixed by the image. light is green. He jerks upright and squeals out of the intersection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky buys a ticket underneath a marquee which reads MACK SENNETT REVIVAL".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Keystone Kop short in progress. Bucky can barely sit do to watch... VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to keep calm. I told myself that just because Emmett Sprague helped Mack Sennett build sets in the twenties didn't mean he had anything to do with a smut film twenty-five years later. And there's a shot of the porn set--the Keystone Kops run around in it like they're solving at crime back in ancien Egypt. VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke Wellington had admitted making it. Linda Martin had said it was shot in Mexico. The short ends with a large pie throwing scene on the por set. The credits begin to roll: "Director--Mack Sennett. Scenarist--Mack Sennett. Assistant Director--Emmett Sprague" On Bucky's face as one last piece of information hits him "Filmed in Hollywood, USA."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bucky bursts out into the evening, the lights on the Hollywood hill catching his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky at dinner with the Spragues. EMMETT SPRAGUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mack Sennett? Helped him build that housing project he was putting up-- Hollywoodland--

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE SCENE
dialogues.text: as Bucky stares up at the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky tears through it, pulling out files. The door opens it's Russ Millard. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got your message, Bucky. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Russ...I think...I may have it. I-- RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It? Bucky whirls around, gesturing to the room-- BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her! Her! I've got a hot one, padre. It's just... Bucky flops onto the bed, almost frantic. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, son. Tell me. Bucky meets his eyes: forgive me my sins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky drives with Russ in the car next to him. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him everything. Me and Madeleine, the Spragues. Withholding evidence for her. Everything. Even Lee. After all of it he only had one thing to say:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Russ: RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, then. It's your ball. What do you wanna do? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to search every fucking inch of every goddamn acre of Emmett Sprague property if it takes the rest of my shitty career. And I know exactly where we start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they inch their way up into a huge traffic snarl in Beachwood Canyon. The sign looms high above them as the " is taken dawn. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between my time with Madeleine and the local boom baron expose in the papers, I was practically an expert on Emmett Sprague's land deals...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge area is cordoned off as people watch the sign bein torn down. Bucky and Russ leave the car there, badge the local blue doing crowd control, and split off down a dirt side road the woods. VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time since the beginning of the whole fiasco, I stopped trying to figure out who killed Elizabeth Short. Instead, I focused on where.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky and Russ play a flashlight over a piece of paper, l two men consulting a treasure map in the woods. In the background is a tiny bungalow with the windows blo out and the door hanging off its hinges. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if my hunch was right, we wouldn't have to look any further than one of Emmett Sprague's condemned bungalows. One that was isolated...abandoned... They walk on, leaving this particular bungalow behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky shines the light in a running stream as they follow deeper into the night... VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and most importantly, close to a water source...where one could drain a body of its blood. Bucky and Russ round a bend in the stream and see

dialogues.speaker: THE SKELETON OF A BUNGALOW
dialogues.text: teetering on the edge of the stream. Empty window and doo hover over a rotting porch like skull sockets over a deat leer. Bucky and Russ feel it, tensing up as they approach. They pick their footsteps carefully through the broken porch a step into the abandoned house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scattering of trash in the front room, animal shit, a bicycle tire, rags. They move through the house, each roam, each closet and corner creeps with potential violence. Still, nothing. From the kitchen: RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky. Bucky joins Russ at the back door, the screen rotted off. Through the empty window they see: AN ALUMINUM GARDENING SHED, the door wide open. You know it before they even get there. But as soon as th step inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They know something bad happened here... Half the room is taken up by a mattress, its blue ticking stained dark brown with blood. A gas lantern sits in the corner, leaning against a stack of blood-spattered books, including a copy of Gray's Anatomy and Victor Hugo's The Who Laughs along with a clutch of pornographic pictures. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God help her. Bucky's already pulling on a pair of rubber gloves from h SID days. For the first time we notice he's carrying his forensic kit. He opens it, revealing the test tubes, fingerprint powder tweezers, etc. BUCKY (throwing Russ gloves)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Box up the books and papers. Maybe light that lantern. Russ grants Bucky his take-charge attitude. He snaps on a pair of gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1. Bucky scrapes blood off a wall and into a test tube. 2. Russ flips through the pornographic material--some of very intense. 3. Bucky fills up another test tube with dark hair tweeze from the caked blood on the mattress. 4. Underneath the mattress, Bucky finds small pieces of rope... 5. Bucky measures a bloody sole print and traces it onto piece of paper. 6. Bucky finger prints the whole fucking place, pulling g prints from the door jamb, the door, and the wall near th head of the mattress.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE GARDENING SHED
dialogues.text: Russ fiddles with the books, making himself busy. Finally walks back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky sits on the floor, his hands shaking as he holds a fingerprint plate in one hand and a piece of paper in the other. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right? Bucky hands him the fresh plate. Russ studies it. Bucky h him the piece of paper with a blown-up set of prints on i The two sets of prints are identical. Russ sees the name the top of the paper: ELIZABETH SHORT. He exhales deeply. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thing is, Russ. Thing is...There's another set of latents up there on the doorjamb...And my hands're shaking so bad I can't transfer 'em.

dialogues.speaker: WITH HIS KNIFE AND SLIPPING IT INTO A PLASTIC BAG.
dialogues.text: Bucky sits on the ground outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last of the "LAND" letters has come down and a party ensued. A marching band plays "There's No Business Like S Business". Bucky and Russ stumble out of the woods, carrying the evidence of Betty Short's death in their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky sits on the bed, the evidence spread out around him Russ stands in the doorway. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We finally have it, Russ. All of it. All of her. (gesturing around the room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right here. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you don't want to came home? Mrs. Millard'll fix up the couch. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Thanks. I'll stay here. (re the doorjamb piece)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to get up early and confirm these prints. Russ nods. RUSS MILLARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a very very bright penny, Officer. He closes the door, leaving Bucky alone with Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky lies on the bed, staring at the ceiling. BUCKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That night I pictured myself the way I wanted Elizabeth to picture me--her knight in shining armor, a reborn two-bit harness bull who cracked the biggest unsolved homicide in California history. A war hero, a heavyweight champion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky flips through Gray's Anatomy, killing time. BUCKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stayed with her that night and dreamed of all the bullshit that would never happen. Not if I wanted to keep my job at all. Because there was no way for me to make the arrest without admitting that I'd suppressed evidence years ago. The case would always be open. And so while it killed me to wait 'til morning, in some ways...this was our last night together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky transfers the killer's prints from the doorjamb to plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky pulls a fingerprint card from a cabinet. He shuts t cabinet. The tab on the outside reads: "City Employees".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky edges his way along the side of the house. A side window is open and he pulls himself inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving boxes fill the front hallway. Bucky hears voices coming from the main hall. Madeleine and Emmett. Bucky unholsters his gun; from his pocket he pulls out a SILENCER and screws it on the muzzle. EMMETT SPRAGUE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...besides, one of my foremen said the goddamn pipes are spewing gas...There'll be hell to pay. It's about time I showed the three of you good ol' Scotland. MADELEINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna go to Europe, Daddy. You're always talking about how dreadful and provincial it is. EMMETT SPRAGUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...they've got what you need, lassie. Bucky steps into the main room, gun prominent at his side BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is that, Emmett? Saps like me? Direct line to the straight dope? Or is that what you needed? EMMETT SPRAGUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaah, laddie. He eyes the gun. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George Tilden killed Elizabeth Short and the two of you covered it up. On the Spragues, trying to maintain their upper-class coo BUCKY (cont'd) (to Madeleine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You helped Linda Martin and Betty make that stag film. Where was the set? In one of Daddy's old buildings? He levels the gun at Madeleine. Rock steady. Madeleine si on a divan. MADELEINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgie was always...sneaking around Daddy's properties. He saw them make it...He...got crazy about Betty. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. She looked like his daughter. Off Emmett's shocked look: BUCKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fucked your wife. But I don't think you cared about that. But he's her daddy. And that must have made you crazy. He was a handsome bastard, too. Somehow I don't think he was disfigured in a car wreck. EMMETT SPRAGUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Argonne, Georgie used to bayonet the dead Gerries. I saw it. Thrilled him, it did. He was...hmm...disturbed. I think Ramona found him...a good way to strike back at me. Bucky points the gun at Madeleine again. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it all go down? She hesitates. He shoots a MING VASE next to her. She jum BUCKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So many pretty things here... MADELEINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Sunday I remember...Betty called...short of cash as usual. I put Daddy on, and he offered Betty money to date a nice man he knew. Georgie'd been driving Daddy crazy, wanting to get with Betty ever since the movie. Threatening to tell people he was my father. But we thought Georgie just wanted her for sex. Bucky blows away another objet d'art. The two Spragues hu on the couch. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a sick fuck and you knew it! Emmett gestures vainly towards the stuffed dog Balto. EMMETT SPRAGUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
