dialogues.text: He was passive. He liked to touch dead things. His father was a surgeon, did you know that? Famous in Scotland. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you tell Betty? What did you tell her? MADELEINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We said he was a war hero. Because we didn't want her to feel like a whore. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then? MADELEINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the rest. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretend I'm stupid. For old time's sake. Madeleine exhales hate. MADELEINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went looking for Linda Martin, and I found her at a motel in the Valley. I gave her money and told her to say the stag was filmed in Tijuana with a Mexican crew. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then what? I come along? Daddy tell you to fuck me or was that your idea? MADELEINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky-- Two more shots from the gun destroy another fifty grand w of art. Bucky reloads. BUCKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole family have a good laugh at dinner that night? Pumping me for info about the case? Throwing me Georgie stories to see if I'd bite? A little hospitality and some cunt so I wouldn't check out your alibi-- MADELEINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky-- EMMETT SPRAGUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramona didn't know a thing. Martha-- BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about sweet little Martha? MADELEINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha knew I'd been with Betty. But that was all. But she's a demon, you know. She even called the cops with a tip on La Verne's--just hoping I'd get smeared in the papers. I scratched her good for that. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha tell you this? She nods yes. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she lied to get your goat, 'cuz no one ever called in a tip on LaVerne's. MADELEINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figures. Emmett clears his throat. EMMETT SPRAGUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passports. All four. Emmett walks to a small desk. He reaches into the drawer- Bucky puts his gun to Emmett's head-- EMMETT SPRAGUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't insult me, lad. He pulls out the four passports (not a gun). Bucky takes them. MADELEINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll ruin you in court, you know. If you go after us, we'll ruin you. Over what? Some little slut-- Bucky blows a hole in a vase some six inches from her. He cocks his head at her, as if to say: the next one will be closer. EMMETT SPRAGUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, laddie. The rich don't necessarily own art just for themselves; we safekeep it for future generations. The dig crosses through Bucky's mind for a moment before shooes it away. To Emmett: BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to see it. EMMETT SPRAGUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just to be sure. I need to see it. EMMETT SPRAGUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I know... Bucky puts the silenced muzzled half an inch from Sprague brain. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to see his grave, you tightass kiltwearing motherfucker. Where'd you bury George Tilden?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky stands in front of a plain grave marker: "George Tilden. 1906 - 1948.  War Hero and Loyal Friend" VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I'd pulled George's print card that morning, I'd already laid fifty down with Russ that he was our guy. Amateur taxidermist, transient. If he was a cop 39th and Norton woulda been right in the middle of his beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky pulls Tilden's card and we see the close-up: "Georg Tilden". Added by hand: "Deceased" VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'd be lying if I said I hadn't wanted to nail the sicko myself, giving him ten rounds of Bleichert rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky watches as Russ tips the gas lantern over on its si the gas leaking out into the tin shed. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he'd have gone for a gun or probably a knife, and the Bleichert fists would've given way to a full load of .45 in the chest. Bucky and Russ step outside. Russ lights a match and toss it inside. Flames begin to eat away the bloody mattress.. VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sprague said they found him croaked in a parking lot downtown, just twelve blocks from where he'd dumped Betty Short. Just croaked. Natural causes, if anything about crazy Georgie was natural. I hoped the evil ate him from the inside out, filling him with blackness like the sawdust in Sprague's goddamn dog. (beat) Bucky kicks the tin door shut, sealing the fire inside Elizabeth Short's private hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky and Jane Chambers drink some iced tea. JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and then Eldridge said: I'm sure that's the case Mr. Mayor, but that's not my dog and those sure as hell aren't my shoes! They laugh, Jane a bit more than Bucky. She narrows in on JANE CHAMBERS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so nice of you to stop by again. Of course you've been staking out the Sprague house. Four nights in a row. (off his surprise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I walk my dog every night. And I'm almost as nosy as you. BUCKY (covering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well. Old habits die hard. He gets up from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky wanders over and stares at the slash-mouthed clown painting, always transfixed by it. JANE CHAMBERS (re the painting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd been thinking about giving it to charity, but it's too valuable. I found Eldridge's receipt... She wanders into the study and fishes out some papers fro her late husbands desk while Bucky continues to stare at clown. She returns, reading from the sale slip. JANE CHAMBERS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Frederick Yannantuono original, inspired by an old classic novel--The Man Who Laughs by Victor Hugo.

dialogues.speaker: A FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: A blood-spattered copy of The Man Who Laughs on the pile pornography--

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: As the slash-mouthed clown towers over Bucky, his head buzzing... JANE CHAMBERS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown in the painting is the book's main character, Gwynplain. When he was a child he had his mouth slashed ear to ear and then sold to the 16th century Spanish aristocracy to be used as a court jester. Bucky steps back. JANE CHAMBERS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right, Bucky? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm fine. He focuses on her. BUCKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd Eldridge get the painting? JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll appreciate the coincidence-- She hands him the receipt.

dialogues.speaker: THE RECEIPT
dialogues.text: "Received from Eldridge Chambers, $3500 for the sale of the F. Yannantuono painting. Ramona Cathcart Sprague, January 15, 1947." Speechless. JANE CHAMBERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it-- He's out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky runs to his car, pulls out his gun. He sprints off the street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky waits outside, watching from behind a tree. He watc as the last of the cars, Madeleine's, pulls out of the driveway. He crosses the street. He tries the front door, surprised find it unlocked. He goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gun drawn, Bucky cases the downstairs. He hears a noise. RAMONA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in here, officer. A red wave of sweat washes over him. He walks carefully i

dialogues.speaker: RAMONA'S SITTING ROOM
dialogues.text: where the matriarch sits on a tiny sofa, her arms lost in silk dressing gown. Her face puffy and her eyes dark, her gray hair frizzy. Bucky trains a gun on her. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you did, Ramona. You and Georgia. I've seen the painting. You sold it the day of the murder. You know I've got the book. And now I've got you. She smiles. Very slowly she withdraws one of her hands fr the folds of her dressing gown. She holds a tiny ladylike revolver in her fingers and drops it at her feet. When sh speaks, it's with complete control. RAMONA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see you out there, you know. Every night. We see you. You don't fool us. You didn't hurt Georgie. You didn't hurt Madeleine. And as much as I wish you would, you didn't hurt Emmett. You're a voyeur. That's all the lesser classes have. Pressing their nose up against the glass. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me. Let me see. She smiles at him again, loving his need. RAMONA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett slashed his face, I'm sure you know. Madeleine was eleven and she looked just like Georgie. When he got out of the hospital I gave him the Hugo book as a present. My Gwynplain. But he was afraid of Emmett's rage...After that...we rarely spoke. Bucky eases himself into a chair opposite her. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about Betty Short. Her face hardens. RAMONA (cont'd) (with venom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the cruelest of jokes. He'd become obsessed with her...That filthy film. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your husband bought her for George. RAMONA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett never stopped hating me. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For George-- RAMONA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For being richer than he was. She looks over her nose at him. RAMONA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I followed them to the bungalow. There was a baseball bat under...under a tree...She tried to run from me...but she was drunk. The first swing knocked her out. I made Georgie tie her to the mattress....The second swing woke her up. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tortured her. She seems to drift. RAMONA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looked so much like my Maddy. It was...the cruelest of jokes. Her thousand yard stare gradually returns to Bucky. RAMONA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha mustn't know. She's all that's left of this family that isn't dying. You consider her when you decide whether we're worth it. Bucky's not sure what to say next. She fills the space qu well. RAMONA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly, though. Sometimes I thought Martha was going to bring the whole family down around her by chance. Her little stunt about tipping the police to LaVerne's-- BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lied about that. To get Madeleine's goat. Ramona's eyes brighten up. RAMONA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh is that so? You poor boy. Your life is worse than mine. Maybe the cruel joke is on you. She speaks with such an insanity and calm it frightens hi And on Bucky's hungry eyes we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUCKY'S CAR peeling out of Hancock Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay sits at her desk, grading papers. Bucky bursts in. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight? BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much of the hundred grand did Lee let you keep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky and Lee sit at the tip desk while Lee listens to a long call, saying nothing...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Kay and Bucky stare each other down. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew about Madeleine Sprague. He knew about Laverne's Hideaway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee Blanchard beats the hell out of Emmett Sprague while Madeleine's looks on. BUCKY (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He blackmailed Sprague-- MADELEINE (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Don't come over. Daddy's having a business soiree--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky bursts in on Lee washing his bloody fists. LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Penance for Junior Nash--

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Bucky's leaning on the desk... BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you knew it, Kay! You knew it all! He took that hundred thousand and split to Mexico and you let him go! Kay fingers the edges of an exam. She looks him in the ey KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so, so good at some things. He absorbs the blow and waits for her to continue. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was going to leave no matter what. I didn't know if I was ever going to see him again, and I wanted him to be comfortable if such a thing was possible. Dwight, he knew I was in love with you, and he wanted us to be together. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't leave, he ran. He ran from the bank job, ran from the frame on DeWitt. He knew who killed Elizabeth Short and fucking ran away! This whole time. You both knew everything-- Kay slams down a book. KAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Dwight! That girl--that girl! I don't give a damn about that girl. She ruined our lives! The room grinds to a halt. KAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He loved us. Don't take that away from him. And I love you. And if you hadn't seen so much of yourself in her you'd realize how much you loved me. (beat) So if you're aware of something more important than that...I'd like to hear what it is. Bucky looks like he's about to burst. He wants to go to h lock her in his arms and forgive. instead, he just backs three steps, slowly turns on his heels, and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky sits in the back of the bar, shrouded in smoke and music. He drinks bourbon and watches Madeleine over at th bar. She's got her hand on a soldier's knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madeleine Sprague and the soldier boy walk from the offic over to the now familiar Room 11. They enter, shutting th door and flicking on the light to reveal

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: sitting on the back of a chair with his feet on the seat. trains his silenced pistol on them. Flashing his badge, h points the soldier to the door: BUCKY (quoting Lee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adios yourself back to the Halls of Tripoli, shitbird. I've got business with the lady. You don't have to tell the soldier twice. He backs out an shuts the door. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been pointing my gun at a lot of people this week. But I haven't had much of a chance to shoot anybody. Whattya think? MADELEINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you'd rather fuck me than kill me. But you don't have the guts to do either. You're a boxer. Not a puncher. Bucky smiles. BUCKY (Scotchman's burr)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaah, lassie. You wanna sell me short to the very end, eh? Now she's curious. BUCKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not as good as yours, I'll admit. But then again you've got an ear for accents. Accents, dressing up in costumes... Maybe a trace of fear in her eyes... BUCKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do another one for me. Play someone else. Rich little slut...Lez...Daddy's girl...Dahlia...Play someone else. Do another. MADELEINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about-- He cocks the gun. BUCKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout the Mexican accent you used when you hired the private dick to track down Lee. Let's see the make-up job. Let's see the fucking dress, mamacita, that you wore when you chased after poor daddy's money. Tell me something--you shoot Lee yourself? She steps back against the door as he advances. BUCKY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you at least have the guts to shoot him yourself? He puts the gun to her forehead. MADELEINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never do it. Never. Remember...I look like her. She grins wickedly. He pulls the gun from her head and shoots her in the knee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cap cars, flashing lights, an ambulance. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We took the fall together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madeleine is interrogated by Homicide dicks. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever the consummate actor, Madeleine Sprague confessed to killing Lee by concocting a love triangle from the three of us...The Bleichert/Blanchard rematch fought over her hand, with Lee beating Emmett and demanding he "hand over" his daughter when she preferred me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Madeleine, dressed as a Mexican woman in heavy makeup a large hat, tails Lee back to his motel... VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madeleine stalking Lee...Revenge-killing him in Ensenada to avenge the Sprague honor...No mention of the Black Dahlia murder case at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madeleine led away amongst a flock of photographers. Her family linked arm-and-arm in the background, crying, only Martha looking like she might survive... VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her story's enough to get her a psych tag as a delusional schizophrenic and ten years at Atascadero State Hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky sits at a table, staring into the one-way mirror. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the brass girl took the fall for the whole family. And I took the fall for me. IAD cleared me on the motel shooting--a cop's code make-good for Blanchard's snuff. WE PULL OUT and see Bucky's cuffs, badge and gun sitting the table in front of him. VOICE OVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afterwards I was fired from the Los Angeles Police Department on grounds of moral turpitude and conduct unbecoming an officer. I thought of turning over Ramona in hopes of pulling a grandstander's turnabout... THE CAMERA DRIFTS THROUGH THE ONE-WAY MIRROR revealing RU MILLARD standing on the other side. VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but I had people to protect...People who already knew that, for the briefest of times, and in the darkest of places, I had been so, so, good at some things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky standing amongst the Dahlia files. He begins pullin photos off the walls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The destroyed fairy tale house is in mid-repair. Kay is i work clothes, painting a new trim in the living room. The front door opens. Bucky stands in the doorway, carryi box of Dahlia files. Kay watches as he crosses the room without a word and dumps the box of files into the firepl He tosses on a match and the box goes up in flames. She moves to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We arrive just as she exits, the outline of her body quic disappearing into the blackness beyond the office door... VOICE OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you Elizabeth.
